column1: Exchange - missing step Odometer in of first vehicle
column28:
Hi Team, we are missing a step in the exchange where we can put the odometer in of the first vehicle.

The steps initially provided to us is:

# Select a Rental that requires Exchange and change the return status to be “In Transit” (this will be the status immediately after the execution of the Exchange) - at this point, 
## the system has a field to put the fuel level of the 1st vehicle as well as the odometer reading,
## {color:#bf2600}*this is too early in the process* {color}and the branch won’t know this information just yet.

!image-20260202-001606.png|width=419,alt="image-20260202-001606.png"!
# Reserve a vehicle for Exchange at a future date time
# When the time comes, go to delivery scheduler and filter for Exchange at pending request
# Assign CSE to the Exchange job then become confirmed at the scheduled request
# The Exchange task then appears at the assigned CSE’s checklist
# Open the Exchange checklist and send ETA if required
# CSE goes to the assigned vehicle and commences delivery of the Exchange
# *When CSE arrives at the customer, open up the Exchange checklist, fill in checkout odometer, fuel level, delivery and/or memo*
# Then save the passed checklist - the checklist items are not mandatory but passing the checklist is mandatory
# Now the vehicles have been swaped in the rental record
# Open the mobile app and look for the assigned rental
# Click on the “i” icon at the top right corner of the rental and selet “re-sign”
# Select Exchange Form and show template to the customer
# Then sign and conduct inspection
# Exchange completed and update the status of the return vehicle to “Available” when it is returned to the branch and ready to be on hire again





Request: We need to be able to enter the *odometer in & fuel level of the first vehicle* when doing the swap as well as the *odomoter out and fuel level of the 2nd vehicle* that we are handing over to the customer
column790:
04/Feb/26 8:47 AM;712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa;As per meeting today {{2026-02-04}} cc [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] [~accountid:712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381] [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] 

Krizia will need to test:

Workaround 1: Prior to doing the actual swap via the vehicle checklist page, 

# CSE to jump on the mobile app > go to rental > update odometer reading of 1st vehicle
# CSE goes back to the checklist page > enter odometer out of 2nd vehicle and do the swap.

NOTE: Would this update the odometer of the 1st vehicle?



Workaround 2: after doing the exchange > CSE to jump on vehicles tab on web platform and update odometer in

* need to check if CSE can access vehicles tab and if they can update odometer in
* Would they call someone at branch to have this updated while doing an exchange? - Admin task



SUGGESTION: Move the odometer in & fuel in fields to the checklist page but this will require customisation and effort

column1: Missing Requirement - No Vehicle Lookup when Adding a new Vehicle
column28:
As per the requirements, when adding the vehicle manually to the system, there should be a vehicle integration via third party services using a search function to retrieve the vehicle information when entering the VIN, Rego or Catalogue number. 

Integration requirements - [https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/CgD6Vg|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/CgD6Vg|smart-link]

column791:
03/Feb/26 11:57 AM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:5c8a70adee0f2d70e23c5f4a] I have reviewed the available documentation relating to the vehicle lookup integration for fleet management, specifically the onboarding of vehicles into the system. I was unable to find any information indicating that there was a request to remove this functionality from the new fleet onboarding process.

The correspondence I have identified focuses on the implementation of this feature in line with the requirements outlined here –[https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/CgD6Vg|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/CgD6Vg|smart-link]

I may have missed something, so I’d appreciate it if you could review this as well and let me know if you have found any additional information. 

Thanks.

column1: Task list - Send to list additions
column28:
Got some feedback from Sy.

Branches often have tasks that are for anyone to do, things such as collecting an item, advising of a visit to branch etc.

Currently users setting the task would need to select all branch staff to ensure that everyone would see it.

Can we please have an option for each branch in the list that sends the task to all users within that branch?



!image-20260128-221112.png|width=671,alt="image-20260128-221112.png"!
column790: 30/Jan/26 12:49 PM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88] do you mean “Select All” and by branch options?
column791:
30/Jan/26 1:03 PM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;[~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] currently for a task to be set to a branch they would need to assign the task to each individual staff member working at the branch. What they want is an option in the ‘Assign to’ list that is the branch, Moorebank for example.

When ‘Moorebank’ is selected it sets the task for all staff assigned to Moorebank branch rather than the user having to assign to each individual staff member.
column792: 02/Feb/26 11:38 AM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;[~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88] What is the expected behaviour when an assigned task is completed by a staff member in the selected branch? If one staff member marks the task as completed from their task list, the same task remains visible in the task lists of other users within the same branch. Should these tasks be synchronised—for example, when one instance is completed, should the corresponding tasks for all other users also be automatically closed?

column1: Document (Photos) in Rentcentric is not uploading in Reclaim
column28:
Photos uploaded directly in Rentcentric are not uploading into Reclaim. Mapping has to be updated in the current “Add Attachment” webhook.

*Suggested solution:*
Similar to what we have done in [https://movigo.atlassian.net/browse/CIP-799|https://movigo.atlassian.net/browse/CIP-799|smart-link] we have to apply the same logic of adding a prefix for each file name when a user uploads a document / photo.



|*Document Type in RC*|*RC to add  Prefix in file name*|*Richard to create mapping in Reclaim*|
|Accident Location|ACC_LOC|Map to *Accident Location*|
|Additional Drivers Licence|ADD_DL|Map to *Additional Drivers Licence*|
|AF Damage Images|AF_DAMAGE|Map to *AF Damage Images*|
|AF Drivers Licence|AF_DL|Map to *AF Drivers Licence*|
|NAF Damage Images|NAF_DAMAGE|Map to *NAF Damage Images*|
|NAF Drivers Licence|NAF_DL|Map to *NAF Drivers Licence*|
|NAF Owners Drivers Licence|NAF_OWNER_DL|Map to *NAF Owners Drivers Licence*|
|Registration Paper|REGO|Map to *Registration Paper*|
| | | *If the payload does not meet the created filters please map it under "Other"*|


Photo for reference of the new UI when uploading documents


!image-20260122-235054.png|width=1054,alt="image-20260122-235054.png"!

column792:
23/Jan/26 8:59 AM;712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa;[~accountid:5c8a70adee0f2d70e23c5f4a]  I have checked with Bobby and [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555]  about this and they are okay to restore production database over the test database. Although we want to make sure that when we restore it that the following is also done:

*Request #1*

# Any email addresses from production be replaced with a test email = [*test@right2drive.com*|mailto:test@right2drive.com] *or a fake email*
# Any mobile numbers from production be replaced with a dummy number = 0400000000 or a dummy phone number

*Rationale:* This is to ensure customer details are safe (privacy) and that they won’t get any test communications / emails while we are testing


*Request #2*

# Usergroup settings - remains the same as what we currently have configured.
# API Credentials are checked and is changed back to how it is configured in the Test Environment.

column1: Production - MBK_RA5 - The reservation status of this file is showing cancelled
column28:
When going to MBK_RS46, the file status is showing cancelled. 

The file has gone to an rental agreement as well has been invoiced. 

!Rez Status.mp4|width=673,alt="Rez Status.mp4"!
column791:
30/Jan/26 5:31 AM;712020:3f46b471-1bc5-47d1-91a4-8fed231066ab;Hi [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] You’re right — when opening *MBK_RS46* the status shows *Cancelled*. This is because a cancellation was recorded on *2026-01-20 15:08:01.613*.

However, *MBK_RS46 was already converted into Rental Agreement MBK_RA5 on 2025-12-18 15:57:56.000*, and the agreement had already been completed/processed before the cancellation happened. For that reason, the cancellation on the reservation *does not impact the rental agreement or the invoice* — the invoicing remains valid.

If you’d like, we can add a control so that once a reservation is converted to a rental agreement, the *reservation cancellation option/link is disabled* to avoid confusion in the future.

column1: Extra KM Charge Calculation
column28:
h2. {color:#0747a6}RentCentric Current Setup{color}

When *Extra KM Charge* is configured the system calculates extra charges by multiplying:

* Excess kilometers
* “Extra KM Charge” value
* Number of rental days

h3. Current Calculation

{noformat}Extra KM Charge =
(Used KM – Allowed KM) × Extra KM Charge × Rental Days{noformat}

h2. {color:#0747a6}Business Requirement (Enhancement request){color}

For our existing pricing and invoicing process, Extra KM Charge is not by the total number of days. Extra KM Charge is applied *once per excess kilometer*, regardless of the rental duration

h4. Example

* Allowed KM: 100
* Used KM: 125
* Excess KM : Used KM - Allowed KM
* Extra KM Charge: $0.2

*Charge Calculation:*

{noformat}Excess KM x Extra KM Charge = Total Extra KM Charge
  25      x     0.2         = $5.00{noformat}



So for the Master Rates setup,

*Extra KM Charge* (on the top field, encircle in {color:#36b37e}*green*{color}) - will apply to all vehicle types where in their individual Extra KM Charge field is not populated

*KM Allowed column* - will apply to the whole rental period. 

E.g. 100KM - which means regardless it’s 1 day rental or 1 month rental, system will start charging beyond the allowed KM

*Extra KM Charge* (column; which is for each row of vehicle type) - if this is 0, then it will get the value of *Extra KM Charge* in {color:#36b37e}*green*{color}; else it will used the value populated on the respective row.

column1: PROD - Admin Fee charge should only apply to the hire rate
column28:
Admin Fee is setup as percentage

!image-20260115-011002.png|width=1030,alt="image-20260115-011002.png"!

However, while the percentage should only apply to the hire charges; it is getting applied to all charges - including misc charges.



!image-20260115-011111.png|width=1030,alt="image-20260115-011111.png"!



Hire Charges only  3647.70 * 3.5% = *$127.67  Should be the value of ADMIN FEE*

However, admin fee is computed from the hire charges (3647.7)  + misc charges (1140.82) = $4788.52 * 3.5% = {color:#bf2600}*$167.60 which is incorrect*{color}

I tried to tick/untick the different options available for ADMIN FEE, but none resulted to what we expect. 

!image-20260115-011416.png|width=854,alt="image-20260115-011416.png"!

!image-20260115-011427.png|width=954,alt="image-20260115-011427.png"!

column1: Production - INV1 Issues
column28:
When invoicing the team have found 2 issues: 

# The City is appearing on the invoice instead of the suburb. This hire is an Australia file so there is no city available. When going into the customer details in the reservation, only the suburb is showing which should be the correct field to be populating on the invoice. 
# If we need to update any information in the reservation, the cancellation reason field is showing which shouldn't be happening. In the event we need to update any information, we cannot click the save button as the cancellation is showing and is mandatory and cannot by pass it.
column786:
# The work around is to go into the customer profile to update the file. 
# No update

Looking ahead, we will raise an enhancement request to explore options for mapping a set of discount codes directly to corresponding rates/discounts.
For your reference, please find the current discount configuration settings in the system attached below. However, we would require confirmation from RC on the intended usage and any guidance on how this feature can best be leveraged.

column1: System Enhancement for Centralized Company Master Data Management
column28:
h2. *Current State Overview*

In RentCentric, companies (corporates) are currently maintained on a *per-location basis*. While there is an option to *“Share Company”*, this functionality only allows companies to be _viewed_ by other locations.

When creating a reservation:

* Only companies created within the *requesting location* can be selected or referenced.
* Companies created in other locations *cannot* be referenced.

As a result, a reservation can only use a company that was created in the same location.

This limitation is related to a previously encountered integration issue
(Item #6: _Repair Facility – Reclaim → RentCentric integration_):
[https://rentcentric.visualstudio.com/Movigo/_workitems/edit/13656/|https://rentcentric.visualstudio.com/Movigo/_workitems/edit/13656/]

h2. Data Synchronization Challenges

The master company list comes from Reclaim, where companies are maintained independently of location.

To synchronize data between Reclaim and RentCentric, the current approach manually import the company list across *all RentCentric locations*, where:

* Each location receives a *separate company record*
* Each record has a *unique company code*
* Company details are otherwise identical

This results in *duplicate company records* across locations.
For example, _CompanyABC_ exists as a single record in Reclaim, but is created multiple times in RentCentric—once per location.

h2. Operational Impact

This approach introduces significant data maintenance challenges:

* When a new company is created in Reclaim, it must be created *N times* in RentCentric (once per location).
* Any updates to an existing company in Reclaim must also be manually copied across all locations in RentCentric.
* Company data mapping in Boomi will also need to be updated (this maps Reclaim company name to RentCentric company name, then company id to each and every location).

Company data is currently maintained across multiple systems:

* *Reclaim* (MDM – master source)
* *RentCentric* (per branch)
* *Boomi* (company mappings)

h3. Current Process for New Company Creation

# Company is created in Reclaim.
# The same company is manually created in each RentCentric branch.
# Corresponding Boomi company mappings are manually updated using RentCentric company IDs.

h3. Key Issues

This process is:

* Very manual
* Time-consuming
* Prone to human error
* Susceptible to missed updates, resulting in data desynchronization

Maintaining company data across multiple systems leads to:

* Duplicate data maintenance
* Inconsistent or outdated company information
* Operational inefficiency
* Increased support and reconciliation effort

There is currently *no single real-time source of truth* being consistently consumed by downstream systems.

h2. {color:#0747a6}Proposed Enhancement{color}

h3. 1. Global Company Model in RentCentric

Instead of maintaining companies on a *location-based model*, RentCentric should support a *global company list*.

* A single, centralized company record is maintained
* All locations can reference the same company when creating reservations
* Company creation location becomes irrelevant for reservation usage

This enhancement enables *seamless cross-location usage* of company records and eliminates unnecessary duplication.

h3. 2. Long-Term Enhancement: Company Master Data API

Implement a *Company Master Data API* sourced directly from *Reclaim*

Instead of maintaining company listings independently in: RentCentric per branch ; and Boomi company mappings

All downstream systems will *retrieve company data dynamically* from Reclaim via the API.

h2. Proposed Architecture / Solution Overview

h3. 1. Reclaim as Master Source

* Reclaim remains the authoritative system for company data
* All company creation, updates, and maintenance occur exclusively in Reclaim (via MDM)

h3. 2. Company Data API

A centralized API exposed by Reclaim to provide:

* Company list
* Company details (by Company ID or other identifiers)

The API will support *real-time or near–real-time* data retrieval.

h3. 3. RentCentric Integration

When company data is required on any RentCentric screen:

* RentCentric calls the *Reclaim Company API*
* No local company master list is maintained in RentCentric

This eliminates the need to:

* Manually create companies per branch
* Maintain duplicate company records
* Boomi to maintain company mapping (for Reclaim ↔︎ RentCentric)

h2. Scope of Enhancement

h3. In Scope

* API development and exposure from Reclaim
* RentCentric updates to consume company data via API
* Boomi integration updates to use the same API
* Removal of manual company maintenance processes

h2. Benefits

* Single source of truth for company data
* Elimination of manual data entry and duplication
* Reduced risk of human error
* Improved data consistency and synchronization
* Lower operational overhead
* Scalable architecture for future system integrations
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: Company in Credit Hire is not reflecting the correct value
column28:
The company field in a credit hire reservation that came from Reclaim is not reflecting the correct data.

Scenario 1: I created a file where there is no Not At Fault Insurer but there is an At Fault insurer however the file in Rentcentric didn’t show a Company in the summary page of the reservation.

Company should show NRMA - as it should be mapped to the AF insurer

* Test File MEL_Rez_292 / CID-85692
* !image-20260107-041725.png|width=643,alt="image-20260107-041725.png"!
!image-20260107-041840.png|width=643,alt="image-20260107-041840.png"!



Scenario 2: File started in Reclaim with NAF insurer as NRMA and AF insurer as Coles, but the company in Rentcentric is showing as Sallen Panel Beaters, however I did not select Sallen Panelbeaters anywhere in Reclaim when creating the file.


Test File: MEL_Rez_293 /  CID-85693

* !image-20260107-042112.png|width=643,alt="image-20260107-042112.png"!

* !image-20260107-042028.png|width=643,alt="image-20260107-042028.png"!

[^MEL_Rez_293.txt]

column1: Production MBK_RA3 - Not Showing the Daily Rate
column28:
Reviewing the file, we have noticed that the daily rate has not been applied to the charges therefore when we signed out rental agreement the file is showing as a $0 daily rate.

We need this to be rectified so we can show the daily rate of the vehicle when the file goes to invoicing. 

!image-20260107-004250.png|width=673,alt="image-20260107-004250.png"!

16/Jan/26 5:51 AM;712020:82aa7e60-100a-49b7-b30b-11acd41a6056;Hi [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] [~accountid:5c8a70adee0f2d70e23c5f4a] 

We have checked the issue and found that the default rate value was updated, which caused the daily rate to be 0 instead of 168, as shown in the snapshot below.

!image-20260115-184242.png|width=386,alt="image-20260115-184242.png"!

column1: PROD - Rate R2DAUPUB should be charged daily
column28:
Rate R2DAUPB should be using the daily rate regardless of how many days the rental is

Rental from 18 Dec to 5 Jan = 18 days 

so in the charges should by _DailyRate_ X _Number of days_

and not convert 7 days to week; and another item for the remaining days

!image-20260106-033842.png|width=1109,alt="image-20260106-033842.png"!

So for above, it should be below table; and no row for weekly

|Charge|Unit|Rate|Total|
|Daily|18|$202.65|$3,647.70|

Please confirm if there is any setting that will disable weekly and monthly rates; and just pickup daily rate and multiple it with the total number of days
column790:
08/Jan/26 1:31 AM;5d230ed2f61f200c217433a0;We have converted the *“R2DAUPUB”* rate type to *“Daily Rate Only.”* As a result, all rentals using this rate will now be calculated based on the daily rate only.

!image-20260107-142958.png|width=512,alt="image-20260107-142958.png"!

!image-20260107-143059.png|width=512,alt="image-20260107-143059.png"!

Please check.

Thank you.
column791: 08/Jan/26 10:42 AM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;Confirmed that rates are now computed per day

column1: Make Additional Driver First Name Mandatory
column28:
Currently all additional driver fields are non mandatory in Rentcentric as part of the original requirement.

*Change request:* Make Additional Driver first name mandatory in both Reclaim and Rentcentric

*Reasoning:*

* This will prevent empty entries for additional driver from both Reclaim and Rentcentric in the event that users add them by accident.
* Both change will need to be applied to both Reclaim and Rentcentric to avoid issues wherein credit hires are created directly into Rentcentric and updates will be sent to Reclaim




!image-20260106-003623.png|width=671,alt="image-20260106-003623.png"!
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: Claim ID (Reclaim Reference) Visibility - needs to be displayed on other screens
column28:
The only way to find the Reclaim Reference (Claim ID field) currently is to:

# Click on “Edit” on the Rental and then click on “Edit Reservation Details”,
# OR click on “Edit” on the Reservation

I.e. we can’t view the ClaimID without loading the reservation edit screen.

This field needs to be displayed more prominently with easy access on the main Reservation and Rental pages (without needing to click “Edit”) and also on the Invoice Ready screen.

!image-20260105-235424.png|width=665,alt="image-20260105-235424.png"!



!image-20260105-235509.png|width=665,alt="image-20260105-235509.png"!



!image-20260105-235531.png|width=665,alt="image-20260105-235531.png"!

column1: RC to NetSuite - Create Invoice - missing reference fields
column28:
Invoice successfully created in NetSuite once invoiced from RentCentric, however it’s missing a few fields / values.

# Memo = the {AssignedUnit} is meant to be a placeholder value. The real value should be mapped from RentCentric webhook across into NetSuite.
# Debtor = this should be the Company attached to the invoice/rental (if any is attached)
# At Fault Driver Name = this should be the AF Driver First + Last Names (involved party where type is “At Fault” and they are “Driver”)

!image-20260105-042416 (8662b625-9ab4-4877-95b8-8dea46fba951).png|width=1349,alt="image-20260105-042416.png"!
column790: 05/Jan/26 3:36 PM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] since Vicki confirmed webhooks from RC seem to be working again, do you want to verify this before I assign to RC?
column791:
05/Jan/26 3:36 PM;6195e625f241500072581555;Hi [~accountid:712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef] 

Few issues that I can see with the Rental webhooks going into Reclaim:

* insertionOrderID is missing from the hire booking section of the payload (insertionOrderID must be included to UPDATE the existing entry instead of creating a new one)
* insertionOrderId is missing from the vehicle detalis section (same issue as above)
* vehicle exchange table: this would create a new entry, but again - if it’s meant to be an update o an existing entry in Reclaim then it needs to include an insertionOrderId

You should be able to get all the InsertionOrderID values from the “GetWorkItem” API call to Reclaim.

Please check 🙂 

!image-20251208-043622.png|width=995,alt="image-20251208-043622.png"!
column792:

column1: RentCentric Webhooks - Voiding Rentals - no log or webhook?
column28:
It appears that no webhook update was triggered upon voiding the rental and it’s not showing in the RentCentric Agreements Log either.  This will require RC support to investigate why the webhook isn’t triggering for this specific action. Any action such as voiding / reopening / closing transactions should definitely be included in the RentCentric logs as well.

 Note: when I “UnVoid” the rental, it correctly sends a webhook with the latest update.

!image-20260105-033922 (95b46945-7b23-457b-af10-27a397a84c21).png|width=1349,alt="image-20260105-033922.png"!

05/Jan/26 3:33 PM;6195e625f241500072581555;Hi [~accountid:712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef] 

Few issues that I can see with the Rental webhooks going into Reclaim:

* insertionOrderID is missing from the hire booking section of the payload (insertionOrderID must be included to UPDATE the existing entry instead of creating a new one)
* insertionOrderId is missing from the vehicle detalis section (same issue as above)
* vehicle exchange table: this would create a new entry, but again - if it’s meant to be an update o an existing entry in Reclaim then it needs to include an insertionOrderId

You should be able to get all the InsertionOrderID values from the “GetWorkItem” API call to Reclaim.

Please check 🙂 

!image-20251208-043622.png|width=995,alt="image-20251208-043622.png"!

column1: Invoice sent to Reclaim labelled with incorrect document type
column28:
||Action||Data||Expected Result||Actual Result||
|Log in to fleet as an invoicing specialist|-|-|-|
|Access the invoice ready files|-|-|-|
|Click a credit hire file an dopen the rental > Hyperlinked|-|File should open|-|
|Click edit|-|The charges section should open|-|
|1. Update the charges in the lower left section of the screen (Untick some charges to remove where applicable)|-|User should be able to untick with no issues|-|
|Click "Update Charges Summary"|-|Charges should be updated and user should be able to see that the items unticked are no longer visible in the charges summary|-|
|Click save|-|window should close and user should be redirected to the rental page|-|
|Open the invoiced ready file again for the same file|-|-|-|
|Select R2DAU_Credit_Hire_Invoice Template_ and click View PDF Invoice|-|User should be able to see the updated invoice and should not show the items removed.|-|
|Click Generate Invoice|-|Invoice should be uploaded into the Reclaim File|-|

column1: SMS history gone missing
column28:
When the SMS screen loads, previously received messages are not displayed. They appear only after a new SMS is sent.

All historical SMS messages must appear when the SMS screen loads, as this is required to verify whether a user response has been received.

column793:
05/Jan/26 8:58 AM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;[~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b]  [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] [~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88]    pls confirm if this was a requirement from our end?

When an additional driver is added and no name was included - the system auto populates the first name with “Additional driver X” - where X is running counter from 1.
column794:
05/Jan/26 11:26 AM;6195e625f241500072581555;[~accountid:712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381] that doesn’t sound right, and I can’t see that in our requirements for involved parties ([https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/H4DRUQ|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/H4DRUQ|smart-link] )

I’d say there’s been some miscommunication.

We are expecting to have Additional Driver 1, 2, 3 and so on. But they should still have proper customer names, not default names.
column795: 05/Jan/26 11:39 AM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;[~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] thanks! That’s what I thought as well — the names will remain blank if they aren’t entered. The driver type will be set to *“Additional driver”*, but all other fields that weren’t populated will stay empty and will not auto-populate with any values.
column796:
05/Jan/26 11:42 AM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;[~accountid:70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c]  as confirmed by [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555]  All fields that were not populated should remain empty and must not auto-populate with any values. If the name is empty, it should also remain empty in the list. Please correct this in the system.

cc : [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] [~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88]

This is the ticket I’m referring to:

[https://rentcentric.visualstudio.com/Movigo/_workitems/edit/12799|https://rentcentric.visualstudio.com/Movigo/_workitems/edit/12799]

!image-20260105-161929.png|width=656,alt="image-20260105-161929.png"!

If the first name and last name are empty, we display them as Additional Driver 1, Additional Driver 2, and so on. If the first name and last name are provided, we display them as entered.

24/Dec/25 6:19 AM;712020:3f46b471-1bc5-47d1-91a4-8fed231066ab;[~accountid:712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381]Hi, the duplication happened because of your earlier request. column791: 05/Jan/26 9:01 AM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;[~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b]  [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] [~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88]   Please confirm whether we need validation for repeat customers (e.g., matching first and last name, email, or mobile number), or if we should allow creating a new record for any customer—resulting in duplicate customer records as is currently the case.
column792:
05/Jan/26 11:27 AM;6195e625f241500072581555;[~accountid:712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381] no we don’t validate if customer already exists previously as they could have been involved in a prior accident for a different claim.

column1: Create database tables to store RentCentric data (test)
column28:
# *Datawarehouse Table Format required:*
+*Columns required:*+
*ID* - This will identify the auto increament ID of tables. *_Dellboomi team no need to add_* this in there insert process as this will be automatically insert the ID when new records insertted in the table.
*Created Date TBL* - This will identify the datetime it was created the record in the table. *_Dellboomi team no need to add_* this in there insert process as this will be automatically insert the datetime when new records insertted in the table.
*Updated Date TBL* - This will identify the datetime it was updated the record in the table . *_Required to enter data when the file has made some changes from RENTCENTRIC._*





*USE* [RentCentric]

GO

*SET* ANSI_NULLS *ON*

GO

*SET* QUOTED_IDENTIFIER *ON*

GO

*CREATE* *TABLE* [dbo].[TableName](

        [ID] [*int*]                                                                               *IDENTITY*(1,1) NOT NULL,

                _--add new column here_

                [Created *Date* TBL]                                        *datetime* *default*(getdate) not null,

                [Updated *Date* TBL]                                      *datetime* null

)

 

 

Please dont forget to *_create a primary key_* on each table if we have a unique record and also indexes to prevent issue and performance. 
*_Indexes can be created_* using the foreign column link relationship between others tables reference. 

Other indexes used as well in query will be required to create as well.

Make sure Ravi will check the table full scan of each query he will built when he will add this in the report. 





*Database Name:* RentCentric
*Schema:* dbo
*Tables:  (*_Vicki will provide the table list excel_*)*

column1: Referral Agency - tracking addition/changing/removal & limiting access
column28:
The system shall implement the following features for the *Referral Agency* field:

# *Restricted Edit Access:* Only designated user groups shall have permission to modify the “Referral Agency” field.
# *Audit Logging:* All changes to the “Referral Agency” field—including additions, removals, or edits—shall be captured in the system’s events/audit log.

These features must be incorporated into Rent Centric to ensure control over the referral agency data and reduce the risk of fraudulent activity within the referral agency rewards program.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663: These features aim to significantly lower the risk of any fraudulent transactions being made through our referral agency rewards program.

column1: Vehicle Non Revenue Long Term
column28: The system shall allow the assignment of vehicles to non-revenue staff on a long-term basis. For each assignment, the system must record the assignee and the assignment timeframe. This functionality is essential for managing responsibilities such as fines or tolls. Vehicles assigned in this manner must be clearly marked as *unavailable* for the duration of the assignment to prevent scheduling conflicts.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663: Some non-revenue staff are provided with take-home vehicles for extended periods. Recording these long-term assignments ensures accountability for fines, tolls, and other vehicle-related responsibilities. Clearly marking the vehicle as unavailable prevents scheduling conflicts and supports accurate fleet management, while maintaining transparency over vehicle usage.
column790: 23/Jan/26 1:42 AM;5c8a70adee0f2d70e23c5f4a;[~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] won’t this rental  be invoiced or will it be invoiced with zero amount Or what should we do?
column791:
23/Jan/26 3:18 PM;712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa;Hi [~accountid:5c8a70adee0f2d70e23c5f4a] just looking at the confluence page [https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1372913670/1.2+Business+Requirements#Functional-Requirements|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1372913670/1.2+Business+Requirements#Functional-Requirements|smart-link] , which mentions 

*“Given* a hire type is selected, *When* the hire is processed, *Then* the system must apply the correct invoicing workflow (e.g., invoice to customer, insurer, or no invoice for non-revenue hires) as per business rules.”



So believe for this enhancement request we should follow that *no invoice is created for this type of hires.*

|RES_026|The system must distinguish between different hire types (e.g., Credit Hire, Direct Hire, Non-Revenue Hire) and support appropriate invoicing workflows for each.|No|*Given* a hire type is selected, *When* the hire is processed, *Then* the system must apply the correct invoicing workflow (e.g., invoice to customer, insurer, or no invoice for non-revenue hires) as per business rules.|

column792: 27/Jan/26 8:16 AM;712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa;[~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b]  are you able to clarify the workflow for non revenue
column793:
27/Jan/26 11:40 AM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:5c8a70adee0f2d70e23c5f4a] 

Non-revenue hires can currently only be created through the Scheduler and do not generate an invoice.
At present, non-revenue hires are limited to a timeframe within a single day. This enhancement request proposes extending the functionality to allow non-revenue hires to span multiple days (i.e., bookings with specified start and end dates and times).


*Proposed behavior / requirement:*
When a non-revenue hire is requested (i.e., when a vehicle is assigned to a non-revenue task), the system must validate that the requested date and time range does not overlap with any existing reservations or bookings for that vehicle. Standard vehicle availability checks must be enforced to prevent double-booking.


Please let me know if you require any additional details or clarification.

!image-20260127-003101.png|width=1255,alt="image-20260127-003101.png"!

cc: [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa]

column1: Update Document Upload on Web Platform to provide streamlined file names
column28:
The system shall provide users with the ability to categorise documents at the point of upload within the web platform. Users must be able to select a document or photo type (e.g. registration papers) prior to uploading, ensuring the file is automatically tagged and named according to the selected category.

This categorisation must be retained when documents are transmitted from Rent Centric to Reclaim, ensuring files are accurately mapped to the corresponding document types rather than being defaulted to a generic “Other” category.

If we can implement something similar to what we have on the R2D website which looks like the snippet below where users can:

* Select the type of photo they want to upload e.g. select registration paper > uploads a document / photo then it automatically maps it to that specific file name 
* When rentcentric pushes the docs to reclaim it will then be mapped accurately

!image-20251218-224142.png|width=666,alt="image-20251218-224142.png"!
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663: Currently, uploaded documents on the web platform cannot be renamed or categorised, causing all files pushed from Rent Centric to Reclaim to be grouped under a generic “Other” category. Allowing users to select the document type and automatically map it ensures accurate classification, improves document traceability, reduces manual intervention, and enhances overall data integrity in Reclaim.

column28:

column1: Using the Registration as the Vehicle ID
column28:
h3. *Business Requirement*

The system shall require the *Vehicle ID* to be set to the vehicle’s *Registration Number* at the time of vehicle creation.

h3. *Rationale*

Using the vehicle registration as the Vehicle ID improves clarity and usability for both branch and fleet users, as vehicles can be easily identified and searched without relying on an abstract or non-intuitive numeric identifier. This approach reduces the risk of assigning or selecting the incorrect vehicle and streamlines operational workflows.

From a fleet management perspective, enforcing the Registration Number as the Vehicle ID also eliminates the challenge of tracking sequential or manually assigned ID numbers during vehicle setup, thereby reducing administrative effort and potential data inconsistencies.

26/Jan/26 8:47 AM;712020:3f46b471-1bc5-47d1-91a4-8fed231066ab;[~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] Hi, we have been updated the test system and the Registration field now acting like the Vehicle ID with this behaviour

  Now when creating a new vehicle:

# The Vehicle ID is auto-generated (next sequential number)
# The Registration Number is automatically set to the same value as the Vehicle ID
# The Registration field is disabled/read-only - users cannot type in it

  When editing an existing vehicle:

# The Registration Number displays the existing value (which was set at creation time)
# The Registration field is disabled/read-only - users cannot change it

  This ensures vehicles are always identifiable by their registration number (which equals the Vehicle ID), reducing the risk of incorrect vehicle assignment and
  eliminating manual ID management.

column1: Updating a File From the Delivery Schedule
column28:
*Business Requirement:*
The system shall enable branch users to update limited reservation details (e.g. vehicle assignment and delivery/pickup or return/drop-off date time) directly from the Delivery Scheduler, without requiring navigation back through multiple steps to the original reservation. This functionality may be provided via a pop-up or inline editing mechanism. All standard vehicle and CSE availability checks must be enforced when updates are made directly within the Booking Requests.

*Rationale:*
Currently, when a branch receives a pending or scheduled request that requires changes, users must navigate through five steps to update the details, which is time-consuming and inefficient. Enabling direct editing from the Delivery Scheduler will streamline the workflow, reduce user effort, and improve operational efficiency.

!image-20251218-053547.png|width=1466,alt="image-20251218-053547.png"!

column1: Add Accident Description & Damage Description
column28:
h3. *Business Requirement*

The system shall capture and display *Accident Description* and *Damage Description* details within Credit Reservation to enable review of the accident circumstances. These fields must also be available and mandatory when creating a manual credit file to ensure the incident is appropriately documented.

For Credit Reservation created via *Reclaim (API)*, the Accident Description and Damage Description must be populated automatically from Reclaim. Where a placeholder or “blank” record is initially created, the corresponding fields must subsequently map back to and synchronise with the relevant data in Reclaim.

This requirement aligns with the specifications outlined in *Confluence Section 1.4.4* (highlighted in Red) - [https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/BAC6Vw|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/BAC6Vw|smart-link]  

h3. *Rationale*

Accurate and consistent capture of accident and damage information is critical for understanding incident circumstances, supporting credit assessments, and ensuring data integrity across integrated systems. Ensuring these details are available for both manually created and Reclaim-generated credit records improves operational consistency, reduces rework, and supports compliance with documented business and system requirements.

!image-20251217-230730.png|width=522,alt="image-20251217-230730.png"!

!image-20251218-061419.png|width=1413,alt="image-20251218-061419.png"!

!image-20251218-061439.png|width=1392,alt="image-20251218-061439.png"!

!image-20251218-061449.png|width=1441,alt="image-20251218-061449.png"!

column663: Accurate and consistent capture of accident and damage information is critical for understanding incident circumstances, supporting credit assessments, and ensuring data integrity across integrated systems. column790: 18/Dec/25 5:19 PM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] tagging you for API updates on these fields.
column791:
07/Jan/26 2:49 PM;6195e625f241500072581555;Hi [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] 

Adding the Damage/Accident descriptions into RentCentric is actually a duplication of information and will lead to additional risks/rework. Claim information should be stored and managed within the Claims system (Reclaim) only; unless it’s absolutely essential in the Fleet system (e.g. needs to be populated onto the Rental Form through the fleet system).

If someone adds or changes the damage/accident description within Fleet; you want this to override the values in Reclaim? Reclaim should remain the source of truth for any accident information. The integration won’t know which version to retain if there is a conflict.

If it’s 100% essential for the Damage/accident descriptions to appear in the Fleet system in order for branch to complete their work, then I propose it be made read-only.

Notes on effort:

* Would require Reclaim development to add a new webhook trigger when these two fields are updated in Reclaim (estimate 2 days, needs to wait for a sprint)
* Would require RentCentric to add new fields to store the info in fleet system via API (?)
* Would require rework to the integrations for both creating a new hire reservation AND updating existing reservations (estimate 2 days, reliant on Reclaim and RC updates occuring first)
* If we proceed with return updates from Fleet into Reclaim (do not recommend):
** then it would also require RentCentric to add these new fields into the webhook on their side (?)
** and rework to integrations to load the update into Boomi (unable to estimate properly as we would need to find a solution as to how we recognise which version to store if there are updates flowing both ways)

column1: PROD - RentCentric Webhooks - Edit Rental webhook is not triggering when rental is saved
column28:
The “Edit Rental” webhook should be triggered each time the “Rental” is saved. Currently it only appears to be triggering a rental webhook when we first on-hire/start the rental; but any further edits are not triggering.

Please check MBK_RA1 as an example (actions taken at approx 3:10PM on 17th Dec):

# I edited & saved the “Rental” MBK_RA1 - this did not trigger any webhook at all and it should have.
# I then edited the reservation details of MBK_RA1 (by going through the edit rental screen and then into the reservation) and saved the reservation - this triggered a Reservation Webhook - but not a Rental webhook. It should trigger a rental webhook with the latest information.

Please check on this, thanks

column1: PROD - Admin users or selected group to have the ability to remove incorrect signed docs in the system
column28:
*Requirement:*
Designated user groups should have the ability to remove incorrectly signed documents or uploaded files from the system.

*Rationale*
In cases where documents contain errors (e.g., daily rates not populating correctly) and have already been signed by the customer, authorized Admin users or specified user groups must be able to delete these documents.

*Outcome*
This ensures that only accurate and valid documents are retained and subsequently pushed to Reclaim.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663:
# In the event that there are issues on the documents (e.g., contracts) like daily rate not populating and the customer has signed the document, Admin users or a certain user group should have the ability to delete those in the system.
# This will ensure that only the right documents are attached which will then be pushed into Reclaim.

column28:
Hi Team, the signed document was not uploaded to the Reclaim file. This could be due to the name of the file being AATA+Rental Form_AU

Production file: MBK_RA2

!image-20251216-211552.png|width=669,alt="image-20251216-211552.png"!
column790:
17/Dec/25 11:04 AM;6195e625f241500072581555;Hi [~accountid:712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef] 

Can you please update the Boomi process for RC Attachments going into Reclaim?


If the file name is “AATA+Rental Form_AU” then upload the document into Reclaim TWICE with the following document types:

# R2D_ATA_AUS_Signed
# Rental Form



If the file name is “AATA+Rental Form_NZ” then upload the doucment into Reclaim TWICE with the following document types:

# R2D_ATA_NZ_Signed
# Rental Form



We will need to figure out a better long term solution for the Reclaim document types since RC has merged them into a single document (whereas in TSD we have 2 separate documents). However this change in Boomi will be a temporary solution for now.

Thanks

column1: Update system and mobile apps themes and URLs following the brand guide
column28:
As per Marketing and Branding requirement, colors and theme of the system (both web platform and mobile applications - Andriod and iOS) should follow the branding guide of Right2Drive, all links/URLs should be shown Right2Drive’s or take user to the Right2Drive websites. 

Example of current issues:

# Color scheme of the web platform makes the logo hard to be seen
# The overall branding and color scheme of the mobile applications do not align with Right2Drive brand guide
# There are links/URLs that still show as Rent Centric or take user to the Rent Centric website

!image-20251217-031420.png|width=146,alt="image-20251217-031420.png"!

!image-20251217-210432.png|width=471,alt="image-20251217-210432.png"!

!Riger IT back end.jpg|width=671,alt="Riger IT back end.jpg"!



To help the logo to stand out – the green icon on green background is a little hard to see.  There are a couple of options below.

!r2d logo.png|width=409,alt="r2d logo.png"!

!white type and green logo for slate background.png|width=340,alt="white type and green logo for slate background.png"!

!Slate type with white icon for green background.png|width=340,alt="Slate type with white icon for green background.png"!

!image-20251217-225603.png|width=340,alt="image-20251217-225603.png"!



*Preference 1*

* Slate background colour for the top strip with this logo – _White type and green logo for slate background_.
* Green buttons & highlights

*Preference 2*

* Green background colour with attached logo – _Slate type with white icon for green background_.
* Green buttons & highlights.

The colour breakdowns are below. 

!r2d color guide.png|width=659,alt="r2d color guide.png"!





Favicon of the web platform should use one of the following icons:

[R2D Icon_green RGB.eps|https://eclipxgroup-my.sharepoint.com/:u:/g/personal/alison_hunt_right2drive_com_au/IQD2-Nk0HJKWTJiPycctBEUYAYL30MsyqhSk63OfRuByHLI?e=tqkbwM]

[R2D Icon_green RGB.svg|https://eclipxgroup-my.sharepoint.com/:u:/g/personal/alison_hunt_right2drive_com_au/IQAEJjoDCWX6S5Poip4lyzTdAWFRITdmT2_b11CWESS-R6c?e=bzO594]

!beb0c1d8-46e5-4c7a-9fe8-963c5c92d460.jpg|width=316,alt="beb0c1d8-46e5-4c7a-9fe8-963c5c92d460.jpg"!

column1: Allow multi selection of values in filter fields
column28:
Request: Allow users to be able to select multiple values in the filters (advanced search) for Reservation, Invoices and Rentals.


Currently, users are only able to select one value from the Status field, which means that they are not able to filter out cancelled files.


!image-20251216-005148.png|width=669,alt="image-20251216-005148.png"!


Being able to also select multiple location in the filter will allow Branch Managers that handles multiple branches to see all confirmed files, etc. or files that requires action in just one list.



!image-20251216-005256.png|width=669,alt="image-20251216-005256.png"!
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663: Being able to also select multiple location in the filter will allow Branch Managers that handles multiple branches to see all confirmed files etc or files that requires action in just one list.

column1: PROD - Boomi Integration - rental updates to Reclaim - missing InsertionOrderId for updates
column28:
it created a new entry in the Hire Booking table instead of updating the existing one. The insertionOrderID is missing.

Richard to fix this in Boomi to ensure it looks up the InsertionOrderId.

*Find the matching RentCentricResID and store the "insertionOrderId" from that matching row. Because for the very first time that the Rental webhook triggers, we don't have any Rental Agreement Number stored in Reclaim yet - which is why it's not finding a match. So we need to check for the ResId instead*

 

!image-20251216-002222.png|width=669,alt="image-20251216-002222.png"!
column786: Duplicate rows will be created in Reclaim in the meantime which will require a manual fix via Postman (applications/integrations team to action) and duplicate row deleted later

Regards,

Richard

column1: PROD - Boomi Integration - Res Updates into Reclaim - treat "0" insurer as null
column28:
The reservation updates/webhooks from RentCentric are failing to load into Reclaim because of an error with the “Insurer” field. RC provides a “0” in this field if the value is empty, however Reclaim has no valid match for a “0” in this field.

Richard to add logic into Boomi to treat “0” as null and not pass anything into Reclaim for that field.

column1: PROD - Involved Parties - incorrect driver type
column28:
UI showing most of the involved parties as main user (renter/primary) - although they are driver type = owner, causing confusion to agent/end users. This only affects UI, as looking at the webhook triggered, the correct driver type is passed.



!AddInvolvedParty-DriverType.mp4|width=1115,alt="AddInvolvedParty-DriverType.mp4"!
column790:
17/Dec/25 7:35 AM;70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c;[~accountid:712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381] [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] [~accountid:712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef] 

The issue is that there is no driver type called “Owner”; the correct driver type is “Vehicle Owner.”

According to the following documentation:

[https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1372356638/1.4+Fields|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1372356638/1.4+Fields]

[https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1471807492/1.4.4+Credit+Reservation|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1471807492/1.4.4+Credit+Reservation]

The correct value is “Vehicle Owner,” not just “Owner.”

!image-20251216-203002.png|width=656,alt="image-20251216-203002.png"!

What happened is that when you clicked “Edit” on the “Main User (Renter/Primary)” and then clicked “Edit” on the owner, there was no driver type called “Owner.”

As a result, the system kept the previous value, which is “Main User (Renter/Primary).”

column1: PROD - Credit Rez Return/Drop-off unable to save until State is populated
column28:
for Credit Rez Return/drop-off address is not filled up, however, unable to save until State is populated.  If address is not filled up, then state should also not be required to save Rez. 

Not urgent change, as workaround is just to populate State with any State value - however, that value might be incorrect.

!image-20251215-222614.png|width=1035,alt="image-20251215-222614.png"!

As per confluence, drop-off should be mandatory - which doesnt seem to be the case.

column1: Delivery Scheduler time slots UI change
column28:
The delivery scheduler time slots are not easy to read due to the allignment of the times

As you can see below the time are centered which reads as half past the hour is the hour


Because the line the left to the time is the hour the times text should be left aligned.


!image-20251215-210824.png|width=671,alt="image-20251215-210824.png"!

The below example is verticle but the same rules apply and it is a good example of what I mean.



!image-20251215-211128.png|width=671,alt="image-20251215-211128.png"!

# We retrieve the daily rate value based on the *pickup date*, not the current date. For example, if a reservation is created on *18/12* with a pickup date of *22/12*, the rate value is calculated using *22/12*, not *18/12*.

Please check the above points and provide more details if the issue still exists.

Thank you.

column1: PROD - Daily valuation rate - data maintenance
column28:
This is related to ticket raised in TEST [https://movigo.atlassian.net/browse/CIP-734|https://movigo.atlassian.net/browse/CIP-734|smart-link] 

wherein, we are unable to maintain daily valuation data via UI. However, this now applies to PROD

For this scenario data will need to be deleted; however, “Settings > Rental Rates > Rate Value update” only allows future date


!image-20251214-120006.png|width=1087,alt="image-20251214-120006.png"!



however, we need to correct the daily valuation of the past date (e.g. below 8th Dec)

!image-20251214-115531.png|width=1087,alt="image-20251214-115531.png"!



As a workaround, until the system enables us to have an interface to do this from our end; pls clean up the data where given below SQL

/* this is to delete only OLD records from Daily Rate Values - and NOT Master rate; and only for the listed vehicle type */

delete from [Daily Rate Values]
where Location='Moorebank'
AND Rate='R2DAUPUB'
AND (  (StartDate = ‘08/12/2025 10:30 AM'  AND EndDate<> '14/12/2025 10:30 AM’)

OR       (StartDate = '12/08/2025 10:30 AM')
	 )
AND Vehicle_type in ('ADVENTURE SPORT HIGH',
'ADVENTURE SPORT MID',
'ADVENTURE TOURING MID',
'CRUISER HIGH',
'CRUISER MID',
'NAKED HIGH',
'NAKED MID',
'SCOOTER MID',
'SPORT MID',
'SPORT TOURING MID',
'TOURING MID')



If any concerns or question, please reach out to me for clarification.  thanks!



cc [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555]  [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b]

column1: Update Mandatory Fields for when Creating a New vehicle and Bulk update
column28:
When creating a vehicle record—via both the user interface and bulk import—the system shall minimise the number of mandatory fields. Only the fields explicitly defined as mandatory in *Confluence Section 7.4* (highlighted in red) - [https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/N4CZUw|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/N4CZUw|smart-link]   shall be enforced as required:

|Vehicle ID |
|Current Status|
|Registered State|
|Registration |
|Registration Expiry|
|Vehicle Type|
|Class  |
|Make|
|Model|
|Year of Manufacture |
| |
|Current Location |
|Owning Location|
|Original Odometer|
|Current Odometer|

|Regular Service KMs |
|Regular Service Months|

|VIN Number|

|Hierarchy|
|Segment|

|Size |

|Body Style|
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663: Reducing the number of mandatory fields during vehicle creation streamlines data entry, improves user efficiency, and minimises errors, particularly during bulk imports. Aligning mandatory field enforcement with the documented requirements in Confluence ensures consistency, avoids unnecessary data capture, and supports faster onboarding of vehicles while maintaining essential data integrity.

column1: Delivery Scheduler - Have Accessories and Exact time of delivery show in Pending Request section
column28:
Hi Team

This has been brought up during training that it would be easier for Branch Managers to have the following details in the Pending Request Section in the Delivery Schedule:

* Have the accessories showing - Accessories Required
* Have the exact time of the delivery requested by the customer - Delivery/Pickup Date/Time if it is a Rerservation or Exchange; Return/Drop-off Date/Time if it is a Rental (this is additional information to the Date)
* Show the reservation type - Reservation Type



This will help the Branch Managers know which accessories to add without actually opening the reservation.

!image-20251211-083352.png|width=669,alt="image-20251211-083352.png"!
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663: This will help the Branch Managers know which accessories to add without actually opening the reservation.

We have updated the test environment.

The *FileName* in the webhook payload will now include a prefix.

Example:
AU_Rental_AATA12EXWEHJizU4JitDlGg46Vw6NAO5YoLEQZeWsE1vdG0YmPlDC00TJTlcLsjRE4wM.pdf

Please note that the original file name remains unchanged:
12EXWEHJizU4JitDlGg46Vw6NAO5YoLEQZeWsE1vdG0YmPlDC00TJTlcLsjRE4wM.pdf

The prefix is added only in the webhook payload, not to the actual stored file.

column1: Update Corporate Mandatory Fields
column28:
When creating a corporate reservation, the team that creates the application, only received the first name, last name and mobile phone from the corporate partner. The drivers license, email etc will be obtained on delivery. 

When creating a corporate reservation, and we enter the involved party details, we need to make ONLY the first name, last name and mobile phone mandatory.

The rest will need to be made non-mandatory. 

Please see Confluence 1.4.5 for the updated requirements (highlighted in Red) - [https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/B4DNVw|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/B4DNVw|smart-link]
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: Misc charges issues affecting pricing
column28:
Misc Charges (e.g. Baby Seats, Booster Seats) - active and available to all vehicle type. Max Days charge set.

Open a rental, but both baby seats and booster seats not listed (on the left list for misc charges) ; and max days was not applied

!MiscCharges -issue.mp4|width=1064,alt="MiscCharges -issue.mp4"!
column790:
12/Dec/25 3:31 AM;712020:3f46b471-1bc5-47d1-91a4-8fed231066ab;[~accountid:712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381] Hi,

This is not an issue; it’s the expected system behavior. Let me explain both cases.

# *“Both baby seats and booster seats not listed”*

The allowed number of days for these items to appear on the rental is from 0 to 3 days, based on your configuration. In your example, the rental length is *4 weeks*, which is longer than the configured number of days for these charges.

Because of this, the system does not show these misc charges when the rental length exceeds the allowed days.

You might ask why *“baby seats”* appears on the saved rental. That’s because, when the rental was created, the baby seat was already pre-saved under the original reservation as an accessory.

# *“Max days was not applied”*

For the second case regarding the calculation and the comment *“max days was not applied”*: this situation will not occur. When the rental length matches the configured days for the option, the *max days* rule is applied correctly and the charges are calculated as expected.

!image-20251211-160207.png|width=464,alt="image-20251211-160207.png"!
column791: 12/Dec/25 3:15 PM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;[~accountid:712020:3f46b471-1bc5-47d1-91a4-8fed231066ab] noted on this functionality. thanks

I created a reservation through Reclaim for CID-85580/MBK_Rez_126 for just ‘Jimmy Page’ this has caused an earlier reservation (CID-85579/MBK_Rez_125) created to show the customer name ‘Jimmy Page’. Correct customer name for CID-85579/MBK_Rez_125 is ‘Gary Apptest’.

12/Dec/25 3:47 AM;712020:3f46b471-1bc5-47d1-91a4-8fed231066ab;[~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88] Hi,

When creating a reservation from the Reclaim API, you are sending the same email address for both main users. Because of this, the system treats them as a single customer and only selects one of them.

Please make sure to use different email addresses for the main users you select, and avoid sending the same email for multiple main users.

!image-20251211-164025.png|width=542,alt="image-20251211-164025.png"!

!image-20251211-164444.png|width=527,alt="image-20251211-164444.png"!

column1: Daily valuation rate - able to update existing data
column28:
Created the last 4 rows via API, while the 1st 4 rows via import data.

The test was  - initial insert has incorrect end date and rates value.  Then import should enable to correct the enddate and rates.  

However, instead of correcting, it created duplicate records for the same location, rate code, vehicle type, start date.

!image-20251210-023919.png|width=1064,alt="image-20251210-023919.png"!

Instead, if the record has the same location, rate, vehicle type, start and end date - then it is able to update the rates.



In this case, can there be an option to delete incorrectly inserted data.  So that for the scenario above, the last 4 rows can be deleted.

This ticket issue is for *Daily Rate Values,* wherein the original request of deleting duplicate records (records having same location, rate code, vehicle type and startdate - but the end date needs to be updated, however, instead of system updating it created new records) as below screenshot.

!image-20251218-011242.png|width=1014,alt="image-20251218-011242.png"!

column792:
11/Dec/25 1:39 PM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;[~accountid:5d230ed2f61f200c217433a0] I have retested and this has failed.

The issue is the invoice status, it does not update to ‘Completed’ when the write off is triggered in Rentcentric. The only way to trigger the update of invoice status from ‘Pending’ to ‘Completed’ is to click the ‘Generate Invoice’ button which in turn triggers the upload of the invoice to Reclaim.

Regardless if a write off has been done an invoice should not go to Reclaim unpon clicking the ‘Generate Invoice’ button, or the button could be disabled.

!After clicking generate invoice.PNG|width=978,alt="After clicking generate invoice.PNG"!

column793:
11/Dec/25 1:54 PM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;[~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88] hi [~accountid:5d230ed2f61f200c217433a0] the expected behavior for wrote-off would be as follows:

# User marks “Write-off”
# User click “Generate Invoice”
# Webhook to Reclaim doesn’t trigger and Invoice Status becomes “Completed”

So user would know this invoice has been completed but written off.
column794:
12/Dec/25 8:16 AM;5d230ed2f61f200c217433a0;The issue has been fixed. When an invoice is marked as “Write-Off,” it can still be completed; however, the webhook to Reclaim will no longer trigger.

Please check,

Thank you.

Please see attached recording that was recorded on the 8/12 but i have tested it this morning 9/12 and its still occuring

column1: Auto Vehicle Availability Search logics has not been applied
column28:
*Issue Description*
When performing a vehicle search, the system returns _all_ available vehicles of the requested vehicle type *regardless of branch location*. This behavior does not align with the agreed search logic.

*Expected Behavior*
Per documented requirements and previous discussions:

# The initial search (triggered by the first click of *“Search”*) should occur without requiring the user to modify any search parameters, unless they intentionally perform a manual search.
# The search logic must prioritize *vehicle availability at the requested delivery/pickup branch*.
# If no vehicles of the requested type are available at the selected branch, the system should automatically search the *nearest branches within the same state*.
# The search criteria must also consider *upper or lower vehicle hierachy* when there is no exact match for the requested vehicle type.

Reference: [https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/FICjUg|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/FICjUg|smart-link] 

*Actual Behavior*
The system ignores branch proximity and availability rules and returns all vehicles matching the requested type, regardless of their branch location.

*Impact*
This results in inaccurate availability results for users, potentially causing operational inefficiencies and incorrect vehicle assignments.



!image-20251208-052240.png|width=671,alt="image-20251208-052240.png"!

!image-20251208-052259.png|width=671,alt="image-20251208-052259.png"!

column411:
*Given/When/Then (GWT) Format:* This is a structured and readable approach derived from Behavior-Driven Development (BDD).

# *Given:* The initial preconditions or state of the system.
# *When:* The specific action the user takes.
# *Then:* The expected outcome or observable result.

*Example:*

# *Given* I am on the product search page
# *When* I enter "wireless headphones" in the search bar and press enter
# *Then* A list of products matching the search term is displayed

column792: 08/Dec/25 9:36 AM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:5c8a70adee0f2d70e23c5f4a] as per Shiela’s comment below, what do the 221 remaining records mean while there were no errors? Were all 493 records successful or not?  Can you please clarify?
column793:
09/Dec/25 7:46 AM;70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c;[~accountid:712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381] [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] [~accountid:712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef] 

“Remaining” indicates that a crash occurred during the data import. For example, if the system was updating while the import was running, it might successfully read the first 272 records, then crash and stop before completing the process.

Regarding the Expiration Month and Expiration Year:

You can ignore these fields, but they must be left blank, not NULL, as shown in the snapshots.

column790: 08/Dec/25 12:26 PM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] since Vicki confirmed webhooks from RC seem to be working again, do you want to verify this before I assign to RC?
column791:
08/Dec/25 3:37 PM;6195e625f241500072581555;Hi [~accountid:712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef] 

Few issues that I can see with the Rental webhooks going into Reclaim:

* insertionOrderID is missing from the hire booking section of the payload (insertionOrderID must be included to UPDATE the existing entry instead of creating a new one)
* insertionOrderId is missing from the vehicle detalis section (same issue as above)
* vehicle exchange table: this would create a new entry, but again - if it’s meant to be an update o an existing entry in Reclaim then it needs to include an insertionOrderId

You should be able to get all the InsertionOrderID values from the “GetWorkItem” API call to Reclaim.

Please check 🙂 

!image-20251208-043622.png|width=995,alt="image-20251208-043622.png"!
column792:

I do have a validation to check if Rental Agreement exist in reclaim. and if its the same as the one being processed. That way we can insert it correctly. Is it *CID-00085547*? 

Not seeing any rental agreement in reclaim.

column793:
09/Dec/25 8:37 AM;6195e625f241500072581555;Hi [~accountid:712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef]

if not create a new one. I raised this one yesterday, but there seems to be an issue in DB.

!image-20251208-220356.png|width=592,alt="image-20251208-220356.png"!

!image-20260105-041458.png|width=1349,alt="image-20260105-041458.png"!

column1: System should navigate the users to the mandatory fields that was missed which blocks the saving of the file
column28:
Currently when a user missed a mandatory field and try to save the file the system doesn’t navigate the user to the missed field or does not notify the user which fields were missed.



The user then have to scroll to find which fields were missed, this can cause poor user experience and can add to handling time.



Please see screen recording:

[^Recording-20251206_134147.webm]
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: Vehicle location based and global values
column28:
Settings > Vehicle Setup : are lookup data that are location specific

Settings > Global Settings : are lookup data that are “global” which means used across all locations

Engine Type

Fuel Type

Region

Gear Type

!image-20251205-063259.png|width=558,alt="image-20251205-063259.png"!

In case they are both valid, can you pls ‘hide', then pls hide the location specific (Settings > Vehicle Setup); and R2D will be using the ‘Global Settings’ as this will be easier to maintain as we have the same values across all locations.

column1: Date formats are incorrect
column28:
Dates are in an American format MM/DD/YYYY across the system while the location setting has been set as Australian format, this incorrect and can lead to confusion, particularly on our rental invoices. 

Date format across the system including templates and documents should be aligned to the location setting.

!image-20251215-061157.png|width=266,alt="image-20251215-061157.png"!

Correct date format is DD/MM/YYYY



!image-20251204-225420.png|width=671,alt="image-20251204-225420.png"!
column790:
25/Dec/25 4:57 AM;5d230ed2f61f200c217433a0;We have updated the date format to *DD/MM/YYYY*.

!image-20251224-175432.png|width=1800,alt="image-20251224-175432.png"!

Please check,

Thank you.

Please ensure that all date format is based on the locate date format - in this case for all AU locations it will be DD/MM/YYYY

column1: Rates - Vehicle Type issue
column28:
Vehicle Types - location specific

Company - location specific (and we dont set ‘Share Company’)

Rates - location specific

Currently,

* No Rates
* No Reservation
* Only 1 company with no corporate rates 

Deleting ‘Vehicle type’ but getting error that the vehicle type is used by a certain corporate rate.

Why would a vehicle type defined for one location be used in another? Likewise, why would a rate from a different location be applied elsewhere? 

The challenge now is identifying where a specific corporate rate originates, since it does not appear in the ‘Master Rates’. Instead, we must check each company by location to see whether a corporate rate was created for them. - this was raised last time, that all rates (corporate or not) should be showing in Master Rates table, to be able to list all rates, and not to have to go to hundreds of companies for each and every location, just to locate a single rate code.
column790:
05/Dec/25 10:08 AM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;And it looks like all the Vehicle type is linked to the corporate rate that is from another location

Sure that is not the case, it has always been R2DAUPUB majority of the time

!Rates Corp.mp4|width=1014,alt="Rates Corp.mp4"!
column791:
06/Dec/25 6:57 AM;5d230ed2f61f200c217433a0;We have enabled the master rate to return the corporate rates.

Please check,

Thank you.
column792:

Location specific values - vehicle type, company, rates - are getting cross-reference to another location.  Please see the attached video.  



Vehicle Types - location specific

Company - location specific (and we dont set ‘Share Company’)

Rates - location specific

Currently,

* No Rates
* No Reservation
* Only 1 company with no corporate rates 

Deleting ‘Vehicle type’ but getting error that the vehicle type is used by a certain corporate rate.

Why would a vehicle type defined for one location be used in another? Likewise, why would a rate from a different location be applied elsewhere?

column365: 05/Dec/25 6:20 AM;712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa;Server Error when editing Damaged Vehicle from Reclaim.webm;https://movigo.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/attachment/content/43719
column790:
08/Dec/25 3:46 AM;712020:3f46b471-1bc5-47d1-91a4-8fed231066ab;[~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] Hi, We have analyzed the issue and confirmed that it is related to the data saved through the API. The error
{{'ddlInsuranceCompany' has a SelectedValue which is invalid because it does not exist in the list of items}}
occurs when a record contains an insurance company value that is not present in the system’s configured list of insurance companies. When the screen attempts to load this record, the application cannot match that value in the dropdown, which results in the error you are seeing.

To resolve this, please ensure that the values sent via the API for the insurance company field correspond to valid insurance company IDs configured in the system. for now we updated the system to avoind the crash again. Please check and offer feedback if you need any more help.

!image-20251207-164634.png|width=1052,alt="image-20251207-164634.png"!

column1: Exchange Function not working
column28:
The breakdown of the exchange seems to occur when you do the exchange checklist and we have updated the status and it goes to confirmed, that's when it changes the vehicle over.

From when speaking to [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] he's advised that it should not trigger the swap over at that point and it shouldn't swap over until the execution of the return and delivery are confirmed which is after exchange form is signed and confirmed.

I am unable to proceed to the app to onhire since the change of vehicle has occurred.

column797:
09/Dec/25 4:36 PM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] I have reviewed the documentation and confirmed the process as follow:

# Select a Rental that requires Exchange and change the return status to be “In Transit” (this will be the status immediately after the execution of the Exchange)
# Reserve a vehicle for Exchange at a future date time
# When the time comes, go to delivery scheduler and filter for Exchange at pending request
# Assign CSE to the Exchange job then become confirmed at the scheduled request
# The Exchange task then appears at the assigned CSE’s checklist
# Open the Exchange checklist and send ETA if required
# CSE goes to the assigned vehicle and commences delivery of the Exchange
# When CSE arrives at the customer, open up the Exchange checklist, fill in checkout odometer, fuel level, delivery and/or memo
# Then save the passed checklist - the checklist items are not mandatory but passing the checklist is mandatory
# Now the vehicles have been swaped in the rental record
# Open the mobile app and look for the assigned rental
# Click on the “i” icon at the top right corner of the rental and selet “re-sign”
# Select Exchange Form and show template to the customer
# Then sign and conduct inspection
# Exchange completed and update the status of the return vehicle to “Available” when it is returned to the branch and ready to be on hire again

I confirmed this process works in both web and mobile app - PASSED

column792:
08/Dec/25 1:17 PM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:5c8e74ee76fb272e06b51a15] please see my following response and make sure they apply to the Rental Form consistently since there is another ticket flagging similar issues that the mapping has changed back to the old wrong format which has been fixed before. 

For Credit Reservation, the rental form should be simillar to the following when signing by customer during vehicle delivery:

Date In, Time In, KMs In should be blank. After the vehicle is returned and rental is finalized, they should then be populated accordingly - PASSED

Rental Will Be Charged To should be blank - FAILED

KMs (Daily Rate) should be the KM Daily in the Master Rates setting not the normal daily rate - FAILED

Days should be blank at delivery. After the vehicle is returned and rental is finalized, it should populate the actual Days - FAILED

Other Charges should only show the rates and frequency as setup in the fees and charges. Do not show Qty and Subtotal - FAILED
