column1: Update Booking Confirmation for Credit Hire in Reclaim and RC
column28:
Currently Reclaim is sending a Booking confirmation email to the customer. To avoid duplication of email which may affect customer experience, we must update the booking confirmations on both systems to specify for different purposes to avoid duplicate - Reclaim to introduce claim process with sample AATA and Rental Agreement attached and Rent Centric to focus on hire details.


# Update the Confirmed Application Email in Reclaim [^CID-00084665 john thanks for submitting your application.msg] to include blank AATA and Rental Agreement documents as attachments for customer preview (AU and NZ versions attached), along with the proposed content updates (attached).

[^Reclaim Application Received Dec 2025.docx]

[^R2D057 Right2Drive AU_U18 RA + AATA_Nov25_v4.pdf]
[^R2D057 Right2Drive NZ_U18 RA + AATA_Nov25_v4.pdf]

# Disable the Booking Confirmation email [^CID-00085426 - Right2Drive - Canning Vale - Confirmation No. WXX003C352.msg] trigger from Reclaim for selected branches only. The Fleet system generates its own reservation confirmation upon reservation creation, and for the pilot phase, we would like new reservations from the Moorebank branch (or any other selected branches, if applicable) to use the Fleet-generated confirmation. All other branches should continue to follow the existing Reclaim/TSD workflow.
# Update the Reservatoin Confirmation Email in Rent Centric to be hire details focused (attached).

[^Rentcentric Comms Dec 2025.docx]




Example of duplicates:
Reclaim File: CID-00085508
RC File: MBK_Rez_95


||*Reclaim Booking email*||*RC booking email*|| ||
|!image-20251204-092750.png|width=1320,height=2868,alt="image-20251204-092750.png"!|!image-20251204-092811.png|width=1320,height=2868,alt="image-20251204-092811.png"!|Both received at 7:52pm Sydney time by the customer|

column1: RentCentric Webhooks - additional fields required for reporting
column28:
Hi RentCentric team

I’ve identified some additional fields that we currently report on from our existing fleet system. I need to be able to retrieve these fields from RentCentric so we can maintain consistent reporting for our business.

Please see the attached list. It mentions which webhook/record type it relates to (e.g. reservation, rental, vehicle) and the fields/arrays required.

If you have any questions or concerns please let me know. 

(Please also ensure there are NO changes made to the field names already existing in the webhook, otherwise it will break out existing integration processes). 

Thanks

[^RentCentric_Additional webhook fields required_041225.xlsx]

If you can please also provide an estimated effort when we meet on Wednesday. Thanks!

column1: Integration - Create Res - business fields for involved parties not correct
column28:
HI Richard

Please check the mapping of the Involved Parties going from Reclaim into RentCentric during the hire booking process (create res).

E.g. this NAF Main User is marked as a business (IsBusiness = “Yes”) but the business fields (e.g. name, abn, contact details) are empty.

*Additionally - the “business” can’t be the MAIN USER or DRIVER. The Main User and Driver must be an individual person. The business can only be the owner.*

E.g. of NAF Main User = is business (incorrect)

!image-20251203-234328.png|width=669,alt="image-20251203-234328.png"!

E.g. of NAF Driver = is business (incorrect)

!image-20251203-234659.png|width=1202,alt="image-20251203-234659.png"!

!image-20251203-234341.png|width=669,alt="image-20251203-234341.png"!

column1: Manual Credit Hire - At Fault Driver Details are set as Mandatory
column28:
For a credit hire, when adding an at fault as an involved party majority of the At fault details should be non mandatory (as per requirements) but are showing as mandatory. 

[https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1471807492/1.4.4+Credit+Reservation|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1471807492/1.4.4+Credit+Reservation|smart-link] 

Fields that should be mandatory for At Fault 

Main User: Black Listed

Vehicle Owner: Is Business, Blacklisted, First Name, Last Name, Mobile Phone

Driver: Blacklisted, First Name, Last Name, Mobile Phone

Please look at the requirements and
column791:
05/Dec/25 5:44 AM;712020:3f46b471-1bc5-47d1-91a4-8fed231066ab;[~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] Hi.

 We have reviewed and resolved the issue with the Involved Party popup on the Credit Reservation page. The mandatory field validation has been updated to align
  with the requirements specified in the documentation.

  Changes Implemented:

  When adding an At Fault involved party, the following fields are now correctly set as mandatory:

||Driver Type||Mandatory Fields||
|Main User|Blacklisted only|
|Vehicle Owner (Individual|Is Business, Blacklisted, First Name, Last Name, Mobile Phon|
|Vehicle Owner (Business)|Is Business, Blacklisted|
|Driver|Blacklisted, First Name, Last Name, Mobile Phone|

  All other fields for At Fault parties are now non-mandatory as per the requirements.

  The system will dynamically update the required field indicators (red asterisks) when selecting the Fault Type and Driver Type, providing a clear visual
  indication of which fields need to be completed.

  Please test the updated functionality at your convenience and let us know if you have any questions or require further adjustments.

column1: Reservations that has no allocated vehicle yet should not be in Pending Booking Request
column28:
Files that are coming from Reclaim, Direct Portal and Corporate Portals are showing in the Delivery schedule > Booking Requests > Pending section even though we have not allocated a vehicle for the file yet.

column28:

column794:
03/Dec/25 1:43 PM;712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef;[~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] error payload.

 {
  "type" : "MMS",
  "direction" : "Inbound",
  "source_number" : "+61450540840",
  "messageid" : "561ec8d5-21d8-4c8a-a6b7-6708b9ad6611",
  "rplyid" : "0d589291-99e5-4b79-a9e6-5613d6b150a7",
  "datetime" : "2025-12-03T08:28:27+1100",
  "StsCode" : "$statusCode",
  "sms_notification" : "Unread",
  "resId" : 1321,
  "agreeId" : "0",
  "customerId" : "515",
  }

Success payload

{
  "type" : "MMS",
  "direction" : "Inbound",
  "source_number" : "+61450540840",
  "messageid" : "561ec8d5-21d8-4c8a-a6b7-6708b9ad6611",
  "rplyid" : "2898df7d-6d72-4aab-9fdc-92a8ee967dde",
  "datetime" : "2025-12-03T08:28:27+1100",
  "StsCode" : "$statusCode",
  *"content" : "Test mms\n",*
  "sms_notification" : "Unread",
  "resId" : 1321,
  "agreeId" : "0",
  "customerId" : "515"

}

Content field is mapped from replyContent in messagemedia.

So I passed if there is value, if there is none then none is passed.

RC API is saying that it is required to have *content field in the payload*

!image-20251203-024242.png|width=416,alt="image-20251203-024242.png"!

So this is not a Boomi issue.

This can be handled in boomi by writing a default content value. But i dont think its the best way to resolve this.

Making content as an optional field in RC is my suggestion.

Regards,

Richard
column795:
05/Dec/25 1:37 PM;6195e625f241500072581555;[~accountid:712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef] 

Hi [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b]  We need RentCentric to make the “content” field in the reply SMS non-mandatory. IF the customer sends us an MMS Attachment but with no actual text, then the content field will be empty and there will only be an attachment.

Currently thr RentCentric API where we push the SMS/MMS replies is making this field mandatory which means this scenario fails to upload properly.

column1: Invoice date is not locked to 'Today'
column28:
When generating an invoice from the invoice queue the user can select any date they like, this should not be the case, the invoice date should default to ‘Todays date'.



!image-20251202-044210.png|width=671,alt="image-20251202-044210.png"!
column790: 04/Dec/25 12:26 PM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88] This is a requirement from the business to allow selection of invoice date. However, if you do not select anything, it should be default to the day you generate invoice. Is it the case?
column791:
04/Dec/25 1:44 PM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;[~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] from an audit perspective this is a risk, it gives users the ability to say they generated an invoice on date they did not.

Also I spoke with [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] this may cause an issue from an accounting persepective. The issue that Netsuite will fail an invoice it receives if the invoice date is not in the current month (Payment cycle).

What is the requirement behind being able to select the invoice date?
column792: 05/Dec/25 5:09 PM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88] this is a general feature across accounting softewares that you can adjust issue date. We can instruct business that the backdate can only happen within the current billing cycle. [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a]

column1: Invoice reference is not unique
column28:

2 credit hire and 1 corporate

column790: 04/Dec/25 12:37 PM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88] according to the screenshot, they are unique - one in Moorebank MBK and the other two in Melbourne MEL. And the two in MEL, one is using “-” while another is “_”. We did that because there we did that because there were defects in the prefixes. In production, we should only be using “-”. These are all location settings. I am closing this ticket.

column800:
12/Dec/25 8:35 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;[~accountid:70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c] the invoicing error I was referring to was per the comment from Helena around the invoice status going to completed right away.

When I say there are some similar data across the references I mean that the 3 files mainly referred to in this ticket have been created by the same tester, there are similar first names, email addresses and phone numbers. I am not saying this is the cause of the issue, just trying to offer information that might help solve it.

The fact is there are 21 rentals linked to MBK_Inv_27 and from what I can see that should not be the case, do you know why this may be happening?
column801: 17/Dec/25 11:04 AM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c] The main issue here is that there are 21 rentals linked to MBK_Inv_27 and MEL_Rent_50 is just one of them. It doesn’t seem right that we want to know why all these rentals are linked to one invoice, which it shouldn’t be.
column802:
18/Dec/25 7:38 AM;70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c;[~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] [~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88] [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] 

Please note that this occurs when using the “Repeat Reservation” feature and starting rentals from the repeated reservation. In this case, all such rentals will be linked to the same invoice.

However, if you create a new reservation (without using that feature) and then start a rental from that reservation, you will see that this rental is the only one included in the invoice, as shown in the following snapshots:

!image-20251217-201245.png|width=656,alt="image-20251217-201245.png"!

!image-20251217-201302.png|width=656,alt="image-20251217-201302.png"!

!image-20251217-201331.png|width=656,alt="image-20251217-201331.png"!

column1: Branch Test Execution Blake
Implement Blankie Process - Update Mandatory/Editable Rules in Credit Reservation
column28:
Blankie file process requires Credit Reservations to be created manually before a Reclaim file (CID) is created. In this scenario, some mandatory and non-editable fields would not be known when creating a reservation in Rent Centric. Therefore, mandatory and editable ruless of the the following fields would require removal in a Credit Reservation (only):



*Reservation Type = Credit, created manually directly in Rent Centric*

*Mak these fields Non-Mandatory*

+Reservation Details+

# Claim ID

+Damaged Vehicle+

# Vehicle Class
# Drive Type
# Fuel Type
# Size
# Option 



*Reservation Type = Credit, created via API from Reclaim*

*Mak these fields Editable*

+Reservation Details+

# Claim ID
# Referrral Agency
# Referral Agent

column1: Implement New AATA and Rental Form Templates
column28:
Requirements:

# Replace all documents with the new templates (new branding).
# Use the U18 merged/unmerged forms as the standard form across all scenarios. For U18 reservations, populate the applicable fields; for non-U18 reservations, leave these fields blank. A customer-facing message must be included to explain this behavior (pending confirmation from Blair).
# Implement data capture and processing for all U18-specific fields. (Part of Reservation)

Replace Right2Drive Direct Hire Rental Form FINAL.PDF with the following attachment:

[^R2D057 R2D Direct Hire Rental Form and Terms and Conditions_5Dec_v4 (fc2e396a-71e5-4b7b-967b-f3a0cbebbbe7).pdf]

[^R2D057 Right2Drive AU_RA_Nov25_v4.pdf]

column1: Integration - AddDamagedVehicle - make/model/option fields should not be case sensitive
column28:
There are fields in the AddDamagedVehicle API request which appear to be case sensitive for RentCentric. This seems to be occuring for the Make, Model, and Option fields.

Is it possible to remove any case sensitivity in the API so that we can avoid these errors? The make & model fields are particularly different as we get them in a different format quite often from our vehicle lookup integration, so it’s impossible to keep consistent.

E.g. for the “Make” field. If I send across as “Kia” it fails (Screenshot 1) but if I send as “KIA” in uppercase then it works (screenshot 2).

!image-20251130-235919.png|width=671,alt="image-20251130-235919.png"!

!image-20251201-000003.png|width=671,alt="image-20251201-000003.png"!

column1: Delivery Scheduler - names wrapping issue
column28:
The *CSE/Time* column (displaying the CSE name) must be widened and made responsive to ensure that the full name remains on a single line and does not wrap onto multiple lines, thereby maintaining a consistent and uniform user interface.

column1: Manual Credit Hire - Remove At Fault Main User Option
column28:
When creating a manual credit file, i have added the NAF Main user details, when i go to add the AF Main user details, it doesn't allow me to. 

When selecting AF - Main User Primary (Renter/Primary) should not be visible to avoid users by accident selecting this option

Refer to Confluence 1.4.1 for requirements [https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1372684319/1.4.1+Involved+Parties#Involved-Parties-Structure|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1372684319/1.4.1+Involved+Parties#Involved-Parties-Structure|smart-link] - At Fualt should only have the Main User option. Main User (Renter/Primary) should always be there fore the Not At Fault only because it is the customer in a credit reservation. 



 Version: 4.3.1.40147 @ 1/12/2025 6:18 AM

column1: Multiple records of the same value shown in insurance company drop down
column28: Multiple company names are showing in the drop down list, each of which were created in different location. ‘Share Company’ is not checked in ‘Master system setup’
column790:
01/Dec/25 9:36 AM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;Multiple records of the same company showing in the drop down list - these were created in different locations, but showing in location they were not created in.

!image-20251130-223005.png|width=887,alt="image-20251130-223005.png"!



“Share Company” is not ticket, and we are not sharing company details per location; they each have their own list.

!image-20251130-223514.png|width=872,alt="image-20251130-223514.png"!

We do not ‘Share Company’ because each of the company can be part of API value in any location, and company is not just for viewing.  We had the issue before with ‘Share Company’ ([https://rentcentric.visualstudio.com/Movigo/_workitems/edit/13656/|https://rentcentric.visualstudio.com/Movigo/_workitems/edit/13656/]) and decided to have the company list in each of the location, so in any location the values can be passed in API.  However, now the values are duplicating in dropdown.

column364: 28/Nov/25 6:41 PM;712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa;On hold rental - repeat reservation not clickable credit hire.webm;https://movigo.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/attachment/content/42500
column790:
01/Dec/25 3:47 AM;712020:3f46b471-1bc5-47d1-91a4-8fed231066ab;[~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] Hi,
The *Repeat Reservation* link is currently disabled because the system’s rules determine whether this option should be available for a given reservation.

Based on our checks:

* If the reservation is linked to a rental agreement that *has not yet been checked in*, the system will disable the option and display:
*“Repeat Reservation is available only after end rental.”*
* If the reservation is not tied to the *most recent* rental agreement for that vehicle, the system will disable the option with the message:
*“Repeat is allowed only for the latest rental.”*
* And if no completed rental is found for the reservation, the message shown is:
*“No rental found for this reservation.”*

In short, the *Repeat Reservation* feature becomes available only once the related rental has ended and is the latest one in the system. If these conditions aren’t met, the link will remain disabled.

column799:
01/Dec/25 10:53 AM;6195e625f241500072581555;[~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b]  this needs to go to RC team for fixing please, it’s one of the issues with the hire booking integration.

When we are calling the “AddDamagedVehicle” API, it appears that the fields for InsuranceType and InsuranceCompany are mandatory in the API. However on the UI (for both RentCentric and Reclaim) they are OPTIONAL.

The API needs to be updated to ensure that these fields are OPTIONAL as well.

05/Dec/25 7:45 AM;70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c;[~accountid:712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381] [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] [~accountid:712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef] [~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88] 

We’ve reviewed this issue multiple times and confirmed that everything is working correctly.

Please note that the status reflects the vehicle’s current state. When creating a reservation or rental for a future date, the vehicle will appear as available once it has been returned, and its status will update accordingly.

Additionally, all vehicles shown in the vehicle search are those available within the selected reservation/rental period.

column1: Integration - Rates API - updated rates API to handle multiple dates
column790:
28/Nov/25 3:00 PM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;[~accountid:712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef]  [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] 

Master Rates ([https://www8.rentcentric.com/RcOnlineAPI_Client{{clientid}|https://www8.rentcentric.com/RcOnlineAPI_Client{{clientid}]}/api/Rate/CreateRate) will be need to be uploaded with a longer start-end date (e.g. 1 - 30 Nov 2025)

On daily basis, there will be rates values which will have daily start-end date. Payload attached.

[^ImportRateValues API cURL 1 (71accd98-e36f-49d5-97fc-19d1c38ddcb5).txt]



{noformat}"RateValues": [
  {
    "LocationID": 116,  /* [Branch] mapped from lookup */
    "RateCode": "CORPORATE", /* [RateCode] */
    "VehicleType": "Economy", /* [Vehicle_Class_Size] */
    "StartDate": "11/21/2025", /* [StartDate] */
    "StartTime": "10:30 AM", /* defaulted as 10:30 AM for now */
    "EndDate": "11/23/2025", /* [EndDate] */
    "EndTime": "10:30 AM", /* defaulted as 10:30 AM for now */
    "HourlyRate": 20, /* [HourlyRate]; if NULL then set to 10, 
                       * HourlyRate is currently not used, but in case used in RC, that it still has value to compute 
                       */
    "DailyRate": 90, /* [DailyRate] */
    "ExtraDailyRate": 90,  /* [DailyRate] */
    "WeeklyRate": 450, /* [DailyRate] x 7  */
    "MonthlyRate": 2700 /* [DailyRate] x 30 */

  },{noformat}

column1: Direct Website - Lead source in desktop is coming up as Corporate Webdirect instead of Direct Wbdirect

# Created a file from Direct website - UAT link
# Opened the file in desktop
# Lead source is showing as “Corporate Web Direct” should be “Direct Web Direct”


If reservation created via the Direct Website, the Lead Source field should be automatically populated as “Direct Web Direct”.

If reservation created via the Partner Portal, the Lead Source field should be automatically populated as “Corporate Web Direct”.

column793:
27/Nov/25 10:30 PM;70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c;[~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] [~accountid:712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef] 

You’re getting that issue because you’re using the "CountryCode" parameter, but you should be using the "Country" parameter instead.

If I use "CountryCode", I get the following error:

!image-20251127-112752.png|width=675,alt="image-20251127-112752.png"!

And if I remove that parameter and use the "Country" parameter instead, it works correctly:

!image-20251127-112851.png|width=656,alt="image-20251127-112851.png"!

column411:
*Given/When/Then (GWT) Format:* This is a structured and readable approach derived from Behavior-Driven Development (BDD).

# *Given:* The initial preconditions or state of the system.
# *When:* The specific action the user takes.
# *Then:* The expected outcome or observable result.

*Example:*

# *Given* I am on the product search page
# *When* I enter "wireless headphones" in the search bar and press enter
# *Then* A list of products matching the search term is displayed

column1: [Rates_R2DAUNZ_Published] rates should be based on vehicle type and not classcode
column28: Rates_R2DAUNZ_Published uses classcode for rates rather than vehicle type, pricing team needs to correct this
column790:
26/Nov/25 11:27 AM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;Working with Carol on this

Rates_R2DAUNZ_Published rates should be based on branch, rate code, startdate and vehicle_class_size (which is actually vehicle type in RC).  However, it looks like the rates are based on classcode which is not in RC rates master 



_select  distinct branch,vehicle_class_size , dailyrate, ratecode, startdate, enddate,  type_of_scrape ,  classcode_
_from [Right2Drive].[Pricing].[Rates_R2DAUNZ_Published]_
_where createddate >= '2025-11-26'_
_group by branch,vehicle_class_size , dailyrate, ratecode, startdate, enddate,  type_of_scrape ,  classcode_
_order by branch,vehicle_class_size , dailyrate, ratecode, startdate, enddate,  type_of_scrape ,  classcode_

column1: Driver Advocate Test Execution - James
Issues with Logging into the APP
column28:
We have had users have 2 different issues with logging into the APP.

# Users email was already in there but the app didnt allow him to input the password and produced this error: 

!image-20251125-212114.png|width=304,alt="image-20251125-212114.png"!



# Logging in Issue - The message is from the teams MOVIGO X RENTCENTRIC chat

Could I request your assistance with onboarding a user to Mobile Agent Pro?
When our user logs in for the first time, they only see the email and password screen—the system does not prompt them to enter an activation code.

Additionally, for the email field, should users enter their user ID or the email address configured in the test environment, given that the two are different?

!image-20251125-212218.png|width=325,alt="image-20251125-212218.png"!



!image-20251125-212240.png|width=671,alt="image-20251125-212240.png"!
column790:
26/Nov/25 8:24 AM;712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a;Hi [~accountid:5c8a70adee0f2d70e23c5f4a] [~accountid:712020:7094118d-ab93-4062-afab-998c5e20b781] 

Please review this. 

FYI [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] [~accountid:712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381] [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] [~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88]
column791:
26/Nov/25 4:16 PM;6195e625f241500072581555;Hi [~accountid:5c8a70adee0f2d70e23c5f4a]  [~accountid:712020:7094118d-ab93-4062-afab-998c5e20b781] 

Your comment on the chat earlier today indicates that SSO would only work for logging into the web browser, and that the user would require a separate set of credentials (not SSO) to access the mobile app.

This would provide a poor user experience, lead to lots of login errors and confusion, increase security risks and cause additional IT maintenance work. 

The user needs to be able to access both the web browser and mobile app using the same credentials/SSO account.

Please advise, thanks

CC [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa]

"LicenseNumber": "ARC1010333",

"LicenseExpiryDate": "11/03/2028"

"LicenseCondition": ["T - automatic truckbus", "S - glasses or corrective lenses"],

"LicenseTypeClass": ["C - Car", "Comprehensive"]

column1: Delivery Scheduler - No validation on CSE/driver schedules at multiple branches
column28:
The system currently allows the *same CSE/driver to be scheduled for the same working day and time across multiple locations*. This is incorrect and creates scheduling conflicts.

*Expected Result:*
The system should *validate and prevent* assigning a CSE/driver to more than one location during the *same working day and time range*.

*Actual Result:*
No validation is triggered, and the same CSE/driver can be scheduled in overlapping time slots at different locations.

*Impact:*
This leads to scheduling conflicts, inaccurate workforce planning, and potential service delivery issues.

At Melbourne HQ:

!image-20251125-060413.png|width=671,alt="image-20251125-060413.png"!

At Keilor Park:

!image-20251125-060430.png|width=671,alt="image-20251125-060430.png"!
column786: The branch manager or site lead is required to verify and manually reconcile the CSE/driver’s working hours.
column790:
26/Dec/25 7:53 AM;5d230ed2f61f200c217433a0;We have added validation to prevent assigning a *CSE/driver* to more than one location during the same working day and time range.

Please check,

Thank you.

column1: Delivery Scheduler - Hiding inactive user from Schedule View
column28:
The Schedule view in the Scheduler currently displays *both active and inactive CSEs/drivers*. This behavior is incorrect.

*Expected Result:*
The system should *exclude all inactive CSEs/drivers* from the Schedule view to prevent unnecessary screen clutter and reduce excessive scrolling for users.

*Actual Result:*
Inactive CSEs/drivers are still shown in the Schedule view, occupying space and impacting usability.

*Impact:*
Users must scroll through unused entries, resulting in reduced efficiency and a poor user experience.

!image-20251125-054813.png|width=671,alt="image-20251125-054813.png"!

column1: Multiple involved parties created
column790:
25/Nov/25 4:30 PM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;Sample data from Reclaim to RC



!image-20251125-052316.png|width=887,alt="image-20251125-052316.png"!



(Not At Fault ) _Main User (Renter/Primary) = Main User = Owner = Driver_   all of these refer to the same person

similarly, (At Fault) _Main User = Owner = Driver_ all of these refer to the same person

So, rightfully, only _1 Not At Fault_ entry and _1 At Fault entry_ should be listed under Involved Party.



To address the duplication :

_FOR Individuals_

if (Fault Type record 1 = Fault Type record 2) AND (First Name record 1 = First Name record 2) AND (Last Name record 1 = Last Name record 2) AND (Email record 1 = Email record 2) then    Driver Type = (highest priority) 

where 

“Not At Fault”  Main User (Renter/Primary) - customer - 1st priority 
Owner (Individual) - 2nd priority
Driver  - 3rd priority



“At Fault”  Main User  - 1st priority
Owner - 2nd priority
Driver  - 3rd priority



_FOR BUSINESS_

“Not At Fault”  Main User (Renter/Primary) - 1st priority; this will always have value because this is the customer

Owner - Vehicle Owner (Company/Business) 

if (Fault Type record 1 = Fault Type record 2) AND (_Main User (Renter/Primary)_First Name record 1 = _Driver_  First Name record 2) AND (_Main User (Renter/Primary)_ Last Name record 1 =  _Driver_  Last Name record 2) AND (_Main User (Renter/Primary)_ Email record 1 =  _Driver_  Email record 2) then  Driver Type = (highest priority) 

“At Fault”  Main User  - 1st priority
Driver  - 2nd priority


“At Fault”  Main User  - 1st priority
Driver  - 2nd priority

column1: Branch  Manager Test Execution - Sy
Direct Website - friendly vehicle names and filters
column28:
As per the feedback sheet between Alex, Yogesh and Bobby, they would like the following:

# The system must display *Make and Model* (e.g., _Toyota Camry_) in place of *Vehicle Type* in the designated area. A secondary label such as *“or similar”* should appear beneath or alongside the Make and Model.
Vehicle Type will continue to be used solely for *pricing, filters* and *reservation creation*.

!image-20251120-051353.png|width=844,alt="image-20251120-051353.png"!

# The existing filters should be removed, as they are currently applied at the *vehicle-type level* rather than the *vehicle level*, unless the system can support configuring these filters *per individual vehicle* or *per Make and Model*.

!image-20251120-050525.png|width=162,alt="image-20251120-050525.png"!
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663:
* *Improved Customer Clarity and Transparency*
Displaying the actual Make and Model (e.g., _Toyota Camry_) provides customers with clearer expectations about the vehicle they may receive, improving trust and decision-making.
* *Industry Standard Presentation*
Car rental and mobility platforms commonly present vehicles by Make and Model with an “or similar” qualifier. Aligning with this convention enhances user familiarity and reduces confusion.
* *Enhanced Marketing Appeal*
Make and Model descriptions are more recognizable and appealing to customers than generic vehicle types (e.g., “Full-Size”). This can increase conversion rates.
* *Retains Operational Logic*
Keeping Vehicle Type for internal functions such as pricing, filtering and reservation logic ensures no disruption to existing business rules, rate tables, or operational workflows.

Additional Driver

'Blacklisted' is a dropdown not a boolean

'Address Search' accepts special characters, should be alphanumeric

'Postcode' accepts special characters and letters, should be numeric

'Home Phone' accepts special characters and letters, should be numeric

'Mobile Phone' accepts special characters and letters, should be numeric

'Email address' does not force email format

'Licence Number' accepts special characters, should be alphanumeric

column791:
01/Jan/26 7:32 AM;712020:3f46b471-1bc5-47d1-91a4-8fed231066ab;[~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88]Hi, we’ve updated the test system and implemented the validations for the fields you requested.

Regarding the item *“Address Search accepts special characters, should be alphanumeric”*: this isn’t applicable because Google’s address results often include special characters (such as commas and hyphens). Enforcing a strictly alphanumeric rule would prevent valid addresses from being entered/returned, so it’s not feasible to implement in this case.

column1: Rates Master should be able to handle today's and next date's rate
column28:
The requirement is to support bulk uploads for daily rate data, including both +today’s rate and the next day’s rate.+
Today’s rate is typically published around 10:30 AM AEST, next day rate is normally published around 12:30 PM AEST.

_Example:_
For *24 Nov 2025 (Monday)* – the published rates would be:
24 Nov 2025 (today Monday): $100
25 Nov 2025 (next day, tuesday): $110

For *25 Nov 2025 (Tuesday)* – the published rates would be:
25 Nov 2025 (today Tues): $115
26 Nov 2025 (next day, Wednesday): $120

If a rental is created on *25 Nov (Tuesday) at 8:00 AM*, the actual rate for that day has not yet been published.
In this case, the system should use the next day rate of *$110* from 24Nov (Monday) published next day rate.

If the rental is created on 25 Nov (Tuesday) at 11:00 AM, after the actual rate has been published, the system should instead use *$115*.

Rate publication is done per rate code, with each rate code covering multiple branches and several vehicle types.
Each vehicle type will have its own daily, weekly, and monthly rates.
column440:
The requirement is to support bulk uploads for daily rate data, including both +today’s rate and the next day’s rate.+
Today’s rate is typically published around 10:30 AM AEST, next day rate is normally published around 12:30 PM AEST.

_Example:_
For *24 Nov 2025 (Monday)* – the published rates would be:
24 Nov 2025 (today Monday): $100
25 Nov 2025 (next day, tuesday): $110

For *25 Nov 2025 (Tuesday)* – the published rates would be:
25 Nov 2025 (today Tues): $115
26 Nov 2025 (next day, Wednesday): $120

If a rental is created on *25 Nov (Tuesday) at 8:00 AM*, the actual rate for that day has not yet been published.
In this case, the system should use the next day rate of *$110* from 24Nov (Monday) published next day rate.

If the rental is created on *25 Nov (Tuesday) at 11:00 AM*, after the actual ‘today’s' rate has been published, the system should instead use *$115*.

Rate publication is done per rate code, with each rate code covering multiple branches and several vehicle types.
Each vehicle type will have its own daily, weekly, and monthly rates.



cc : [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555]  [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] 



Sample below :

RateCode = R2DAUPUB for different branches for vehicle type = ‘SUV Small < $40k’

!image-20251125-034717.png|width=927,alt="image-20251125-034717.png"!

And that same code, per branch will have different daily, weekly and monthly rates for several vehicle types

!image-20251125-034942.png|width=927,alt="image-20251125-034942.png"!

Attached latest published rates.

Note that EndDate is not set yet, it will be update by next day (26th Nov), when the new rates for 26th and 27th Nov is updated.  EndDate will then be updated to 25th Nov - so, those records will have start date and endate = 25th Nov 2025.

column1: User can receive an sms reply from a customer via fleet system
Integration - RentCentric to NetSuite - Customer Creation missing/wrong country
column28:
The customer creation process triggered from RentCentric into NetSuite is not populating the Country correctly. Please double check to ensure the data is being received from RentCentric correctly, mapped via Boomi and uploaded into NetSuite APIs.

E.g. this customer should have the country of Australia:

!image-20251124-052923.png|width=671,alt="image-20251124-052923.png"!

But it created in NetSuite with the country as “New Zealand”:

!image-20251124-053002.png|width=671,alt="image-20251124-053002.png"!
column790:
25/Nov/25 9:08 AM;712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef;Hi [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] ,

This is acknowledged,

question? is it normal for the country to be null?

Regards,

Richard
column792:
25/Nov/25 9:13 AM;712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef;[~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] ok got it. Cause the logic i implemented was check if its australia, if not then new zealand.

Since it was null. its using new zealand.

Should i change that logic? or have the input payload fixed?

Regards,

Richard
column794: 26/Nov/25 1:20 PM;6195e625f241500072581555;This is working now, thanks Richard. Successful for both AU and NZ customer.[~accountid:712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef]

column1: Integration - Reclaim to RentCentric - Hire Booking - missing field values
column28:
When we create a Reservation in RentCentric via API (from Reclaim - i.e. credit hire), there are some fields that are not populating correctly. Please check at which step of the integration the errors are being caused:

# is the data being received correctly from the Reclaim webhook?
# is it mapped correctly through Boomi process?
# is it imported correctly into RentCentric API?



*Reservation MEL_Rez_61 (ID 266) for CID-00085328:*



# AddInvolvedParty API
## The process is creating duplicate entries for main user / owner / driver even when they are a single person. Each entry should be for a unique person only.
## Country is blank (should be Australia) on the primary customer
## License Number is blank on the primary customer 
## License Expiry Date iis blank on the primary customer



# AddDamagedVehicle API
## The NAF and AF damaged vehicles didn’t get added to the Reservation



# Accident Details (main CreateRes API)
## The Accident Country is blank (should be Australia)



Attached is the payload received from Reclaim for the hire booking.[^1763961240616.dat] 

The RentCentric API responses for Create Res:

{noformat}{
  "Status": "OK",
  "Code": 200,
  "ErrorMessage": "",
  "Result": {
    "ReservationId": 266,
    "ReservationNumber": "MEL_Rez_61",
    "CustomerId": 239,
    "ErrorMessage": ""
  }
}{noformat}

The RentCentric API responses for AddDamagedVehicle:

{noformat}{
  "Status": "NotFound",
  "Code": 404,
  "ErrorMessage": "(insuranceCompany) 'AAMI (SA/WA/NT/TAS/QLD)' does not exist in the database.",
  "Result": null
}{noformat}

If you believe we are sending the correct fields & values, and that the errors are caused on the RentCentric end of the API, then we can re-assign to them for further investigation next.

Thanks

column800:
10/Dec/25 4:26 PM;6195e625f241500072581555;Hi [~accountid:712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef] 

Here are some examples of the file name we receive from RentCentric:

!image-20251210-052338.png|width=464,alt="image-20251210-052338.png"!

If the filename contains ‘%authority%’ and ‘%nz%’ then please map to “*R2D_ATA_NZ_Signed*”.

If the filename contains ‘%authority%’ and NOT ‘%nz%’ then please map to “*R2D_ATA_AU_Signed*”.

If the filename contains ‘%agreement%’ then please map to “*Rental Form*”.

If the attachment is being received from the RentCentric INVOICE webhook then map it to “*Rental Invoice*”.

ELSE send as “*Other*”.

Rates upload issue
column28:
this is the rates csv template



[^RatesUploads.csv]



per location, each RateCode can have multiple VehicleType, provided that they will all have the same rates.

!image-20251124-015949.png|width=1143,alt="image-20251124-015949.png"!

However, our single rate code (e.g. R2DAUPUB)  has different rates based on the Vehicle class (VehicleType), which means to do the above csv file it will be but Ratecode needs to be unique, so it’s not allowing the upload

||*RateCode*||VehicleType||DailyRate||WeeklyRate||MonthlyRate||
|R2DAUPUB|Comm. Heavy Buses < 20 Seats|265|265|265|
|R2DAUPUB|Commercial PU/CC 2wd|122|122|122|
|R2DAUPUB|Commercial PU/CC 4wd|179|179|179|

column1: Damages not being captured have to try multiple times before it saves
column28:
When marking the damages and dragging the letters, sometimes it doesn’t save in the box. This affect user experience.



[^Marking Damages.webm]
column790:
25/Dec/25 7:31 AM;712020:3f46b471-1bc5-47d1-91a4-8fed231066ab;[~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] Hi, we have updated the test system with enhancements for the damages conditons behavior.

 I've made significant improvements to the drag and drop functionality for the Damage Diagram. Here's a summary of the changes:

  Summary of Improvements

# Larger & More Visible Drop Targets

* Increased hotspot size from 30x30px to 34x34px
* Hotspots now have a subtle background so users can see where to drop
* When dragging starts, hotspots expand to 40x40px making them easier to hit

# Visual Feedback During Drag

* Drag-over highlight: When dragging over a hotspot, it highlights with a blue glow and scales up
* Container awareness: All hotspots become more visible when a drag is in progress
* Marked hotspot feedback: Shows red highlight when hovering over already-marked boxes (to indicate replacement)

# Click-to-Select Alternative (New!)

  Users now have two ways to mark damage:

* Drag & Drop: Traditional method (improved)
* Click-to-Select:
a. Click a damage type (D, S, C, etc.)
b. The selected token gets highlighted
c. All empty hotspots start pulsing
d. Click on any hotspot to apply the mark

  This is much more accurate and works great on all devices.

# Touch Device Support

* Added touch event handlers for mobile/tablet users
* Click-to-select works perfectly on touch devices

# User Experience Enhancements

* Updated tooltips: "drag or click to select, then click a box"
* Press ESC to cancel selection
* Click outside diagram area to cancel selection
* Clear visual indication of which token is selected

  The drop behavior is now consistent and user-friendly. Users who struggle with drag-and-drop accuracy can simply click to select a damage type, then click on the boxes they want to mark.

!Damages drag and drop behavior.mp4|width=868,alt="Damages drag and drop behavior.mp4"!

column791: 21/Nov/25 1:48 PM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:5c8a70adee0f2d70e23c5f4a] this is critical for UAT as we will be creating files from Reclaim via API for different branches into Rent Centric. Why this error would occur? And where do we set up the branch/location operating hours if this is the problem???
column792:
24/Nov/25 7:19 AM;70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c;[~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] [~accountid:712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef] 

Please note that each location has its own operating hours.

According to the return message:

*{"Status":"OK","Code":200,"ErrorMessage":"","Result":{"Message":"Invalid pickup date. Melbourne HQ is closed at 15:00:00. Please choose a time between 08:00:00 and 12:00:00."}}*

It appears you’re using the “Melbourne HQ” location instead of “Moorebank”.

Please double-check the request body to ensure that the pickup date falls within the operating hours, and that the pickup location is set to Moorebank, not Melbourne HQ.

Please provide us with the full request you used so we can investigate further.

column799:
11/Dec/25 9:34 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;I used this oppourtunity to test the base rate along with multiple extras and sadly the calculations are not working.

MBK_Rent_13/MBK_Inv_10

1 off fees are correct but anything requiring multiplication by the 8 day hire period is not correct.

Further to this if there is a long list of charges the invoice does not format to accomodate them.

!image-20251210-223433.png|width=800,alt="image-20251210-223433.png"!
column800:
12/Dec/25 12:25 PM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:5d230ed2f61f200c217433a0] As Gary noted, the amounts are not adding up. In addition to his comment, I would like to highlight the following:

* If the rate structure is set as Daily Rate = $1 and Weekly Rate = $5, the invoice should reflect separate line items—for example, an 9-day hire should display 7 days (Qty 1)  at $5 = $5 and 2 days (Qty 2) at $1 = $2.
* If the number of line items exceeds the space available on a single-page invoice, the system should automatically generate a second page rather than allowing content to overlap.

Thanks for looking into this.

18/Nov/25 11:40 PM;5d1dac3e1831070d1cd283ef;Hi [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b],

Kindly please note there is a setup for the (check in) date / Time is called “Keep Original Return Date at End Rental”
When you *mark the option ON*, so the rental return date will be as is the original return date, and when you *leave it unmarked* so the Rental return date will be the current date/Time you are making the check in.



!image-20251118-123255.png|width=882,alt="image-20251118-123255.png"!

!image-20251118-123752.png|width=867,alt="image-20251118-123752.png"!

column795:
20/Nov/25 4:14 PM;712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa;Hi [~accountid:5d1dac3e1831070d1cd283ef] [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] , thank you, I have retested again and the time seems to be about 1hr behind - could this be due to the daylight saving?

Currently Melbourne is UTC+11
Melbourne operates on *Australian Eastern Standard Time (AEST, UTC+10) or Daylight Time (AEDT, UTC+11)*.

* I tried to “check in” a vehicle at 3:11pm Sydney Time (I am based in Sydney) under Melbourn HQ branch - Melbourne and Sydney are the same time due to Daylight saving
* The iOS app is showing the time as 2:11pm which is 1 hour behind
* !Collection Time.mp4|width=332,alt="Collection Time.mp4"!




*Is there a setting that we need to configure on our end to fix this or is it something in the backend that needs to be adjusted? If you can let us know please, thank you.*

column1: Normal and Corporate Rates Differientations
column28:
It will be difficult to keep track of all the companies that has corporate rate.

For example, NRMA is available across multiple branches, but only the Melbourne and Seven Hills branches have corporate rates.

Now, imagine there are over 100 companies operating across the different branches. We’ll need to remember that although NRMA exists in several branches, corporate rates only apply to Melbourne and Seven Hills.

To update those corporate rates, we currently have to go into the company record for each specific branch and update them there, since corporate rates aren’t displayed in the standard “Master Rates” UI. This means we must manually track which company has corporate rates at which branch — and if there are 50 companies with corporate rates across various branches, it becomes quite difficult to manage and remember all of them.

A more efficient approach would be to have _all_ rates (both normal and corporate) listed in the Master Rates UI. We could then add a column indicating whether a rate is “Normal” or “Corporate.” If it’s a corporate rate, the associated company should also be displayed.

This way, we’d manage everything from a single Master Rates UI, simplifying updates and visibility.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column790:
25/Dec/25 1:54 AM;5d230ed2f61f200c217433a0;We have added a new column to display the company. If a company is shown, it indicates a *Corporate* rate; otherwise, it is a *Normal* rate.

!image-20251224-145357.png|width=527,alt="image-20251224-145357.png"!



Please check,

Thank you.

column1: Editable Fields for Manual Credit Reservation
column28: The fields “Claim ID”, “Source of Business”, and “Vehicle Type”, etc. must be made editable to support the creation and management of manual credit reservations.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: Pending Invoice "In Review" Flag and Filter
column28: The system shall enable the Invoice Administrator to mark any Pending Invoice as “In Review” to indicate that it requires further action (such as escalation or verification with Branch or Claims) before finalizing/generating an invoice. The “In Review” flag shall be controlled by an easy-to-use on/off switch available on both the Invoice Ready page and the individual invoice page, with the switch defaulting to “off” for all invoices. When applied, the system shall store and display the status on the invoice record, allow users to filter In Review items on the Invoice Ready Dashboard.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663: Providing an “In Review” flag with intuitive on/off controls ensures that invoices requiring additional validation are clearly identified and managed with minimal friction. Defaulting the flag to off prevents accidental classification while allowing administrators to intentionally set the status when needed. Displaying and enabling dashboard filtering enhances visibility and prioritization. This consolidated functionality strengthens workflow efficiency and reduces the risk of premature or inaccurate invoice generation.

column1: Enable Editing of Non-Revenue Tasks in Delivery Scheduler
column28: Users must be able to edit non-revenue tasks directly from the schedule view within the delivery scheduler. This functionality will support efficient task management and ensure flexibility in updating task details as needed.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: Multi-Note Selection Enhancement for Printing/Exporting
column28: The system shall enhance the existing note selection functionality to support multi-select capabilities, including a 'Select All' option. This improvement is intended to streamline the printing process by allowing users to efficiently select and print/export multiple notes in a single action, thereby reducing manual effort and improving overall operational efficiency.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: Document Category Mapping for Reclaim Integration
column28: Each document attachment shall include a category type to facilitate accurate mapping into Reclaim and allow users to identify document types without opening the files.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: Configurable Alert Parameters
column28: Alert parameters shall be configurable by administrators to allow flexibility in managing notification thresholds and conditions.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: Make Filter for Repair/Maintenance Programs
column28: The Repair/Maintenance Programs edit screen shall include a new filter for vehicle Make, in addition to the existing Model filter, to enhance data segmentation and usability.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: API Management for Master Data
column28: The system shall enable all master data entities — including referrals, repair facilities, and make/model lists — to be managed via APIs to support centralized and scalable data integration.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: U18 Rental Agreement & AATA
column28:
When the customer who is driving our vehicle is under 18 years old, they will require a parent/guardian to be sign the document. 

The document has spaces for the driver and the guardian to sign. The guardian sections to sign is free text. 

When on hiring a customer in rent centric, we need to be able to select which document requires signing at the time of delivery.
column540: Users at the time of delivery to be able to select whether that document requires signing.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: Difficulty in checking for corporate rates
column28:
Normal rates (not link to any company) - can be viewed via Rates → Rental Rates → Master Rates



!image-20251113-050105.png|width=730,alt="image-20251113-050105.png"!

However, for company rates,  has to go to the company → Corporate Rates



!image-20251113-050234.png|width=767,alt="image-20251113-050234.png"!





If we have 500 companies, and 50 of those will have corporate rates - we should be able to see all those corporate rates in 1 master list. We wont be able to remember all the companies that are having corporate rates, so will have to check each one of the companies, and click “Corporate Rates” just to determine which ones are  having corporate rates.



Rather,  Master Rates should have a column that identifies it as a corporate rate and for which company it is.  So if the rate is not associated to any company, then it will just be blank.
column790:
19/Dec/25 3:42 PM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;As per the current production version : 4.3.1.42702 @ 12/12/2025 8:43 AM

All rates - including corporate rates can now be viewed in ‘Master Rates’ UI, however, given all the rates there is no way to identify which ones are corporate and which are not.  Also, for corporate rates, there is no way to identify which company the rates relate to.

So as an enhancement, in ‘Master Rates’, there should be a field that specifies that it is a corporate rate and which company it is linked to.

column1: Fleet Management Test Plan
Direct website to be set up for both UAT and Production
column28:
Please review the following items identified during validation:

# *Environment Configuration:*
#* As per discussion with Alex, [https://rental.right2drive.com.au/|https://rental.right2drive.com.au/|smart-link]  will ramain pointing to Production while [https://movigo.i-rezz.com/|https://movigo.i-rezz.com/|smart-link] will be used for *UAT* as *Direct Reservation*. 
#* A clear separation of instances is required for the full development cycle — *Development, Testing, and Production* environments should operate independently.
# *Vehicle Display Logic:*
#* The current display shows *Vehicle Type*, which may not be meaningful to customers.
#* It should instead display as *Make + Model* on the website.
#* *Note:* Pricing should continue to reference the *Vehicle Type* in the backend.
# *Address Validation:*
#* Please confirm whether the *Suburb, City, and State* rules are consistent with the system’s logic and address mapping requirements.
# *Pending Clarification:*
#* Where are we currently sending the [_missing or incomplete detail — please specify_]? Insurance Company, Policy Number and Special Request/Location Information data to?

column1: Amazon connect on Mobile Devices
column28: We need the branch, and any team member in it be able to take their branches calls while not on a desk. Freeing up movements, multi-site management and maximising our in-branch support network.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663: This enhancement would see an increase in our ability to answer incoming calls, having said that there is a risk that those away from a PC would receive calls they are unable to answer, this would need to be planned for

column1: Live chat
column28: Marketing would like to know if Amazon Connect supports any sort of live chat function that can be implemented
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663: Opening this channel of communication will allow customers to ask questions through the R2D portal. This will see improved assessment of eligibility and reduce rejected applications

column1: Outbound call triggered when online application submitted
column28:
To improve speed to contact Marketing would like to know if it would be possible to trigger a call to a customer at the point they submit an online application.

This call would then be directed to an available agent.

They are also interested in the potential of an AI sales rep to route these calls to.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663: Speed to service would be improved

column1: Marketing Campaign Tracking
column28: Marketing would like to know if there is a potential solution that would allow Google Ads campaign data to be captured through Amazon Connect and placed against a Reclaim (claims system) ID that would allow them to report on the success rate of marketing campaigns.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663: Ability to track campaign success directs marketing to focus their attention and will result in more leads, also would mean we can move away from current tracking processes which are costly.
column790:
11/Nov/25 10:30 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;Met with Steve and Chris (Contacx) who confirmed that they would essentially need to recreate what Infinity do for us in Amazon and maintain, this would require a lot of effort and maintenance.

Confirmed with [~accountid:630ff7b562fe1e6eac6c5987] as this is the case we can close this ticket.

column1: Omnichannel for referrer workflow
column28:
Currently referral leads can be submitted via SMS, Email, Phone or Web, as a result it is difficult to prioritise work as the multiple channels are not synced.

It was mentioned by a previous developer that it may be possible to create an omnichannel in Amazon connect so that tasks from different channels can be monitored in one place.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663: This enhancement would see referrals treated with the correct priority regardless of how they were submitted.
column790:
11/Nov/25 10:52 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;Met with Steve and Chris (Contacx) who confirmed that there is a task management function that can be used in Amazon connect.

The requirement is focused around the prioritisation of inbound emails to the referrer inbox and reporting on how they are actioned, Steve and Chris advised that Amazon omnichannel is not suited to this, reporting will likely prove difficult, features required are more suited to CRM.

Comments from Steve/Chris ‘You would likely hit the limit of what this feature is capable of quickly’.

Advised [~accountid:712020:19c9fbf8-8942-4a6a-b36a-c819be1e1dcf] of this and got permission to close this ticket, she will lodge a ticket with IT for the creation of a BI report to provide insight into referrer inbox management.

column1: Automatic call routing
column28: This enhancement would see calls to R2D lines automatically routed to the relevant user/department based on the number the call is from
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

Ben Rouse also mentioned that he would like virtual hold to be implemented to Local ops lines, I am not confident this is required as hold times should be short for Local ops, reporting on local ops hold times should be reviewed before we consider implementing in this area.

column1: Add Mandatory Fields for Additional Driver on Reservation
column28:
h2. Summary

Add Mandatory Fields for Additional Driver on Reservation

h2. Context

When adding an Additional Driver to a reservation, the system must require the following mandatory fields: First Name, Last Name, Date of Birth, License Number, License Expiry Date, and License Country of Issue. This was raised by @Shiela Araullo with low priority on 9/29/2025.

h2. Acceptance criteria

* The following fields are mandatory when adding an Additional Driver: First Name, Last Name, Date of Birth, License Number, License Expiry Date, and License Country of Issue.
* The system prevents saving or proceeding without all mandatory fields being completed.
* User interface clearly indicates which fields are mandatory.

h2. Other information

Status: open.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: Review and Update EAG Acronym Usage for Northgate
column28:
h2. Summary

Review and Update EAG Acronym Usage for Northgate

h2. Context

The business no longer requires the use of "EAG" (Eagle Farm) for the Northgate acronym. The BI Team needs to review report mapping to ensure nothing is checking for "EAG" specifically. This is a high priority task raised by @Helena Georgiadis on 10/22/2025.

h2. Acceptance criteria

* All report mappings are reviewed for references to "EAG" in the context of Northgate.
* Any dependencies or checks for "EAG" are updated or removed as required.
* The system no longer uses "EAG" for Northgate in any reports or mappings.

h2. Other information

Status: open.

* Captured details are included in all relevant documents, including the AATA.

column1: Automate Customer Claim Form Submission and Damage Record Generation
column28:
h2. Summary

Automate Customer Claim Form Submission and Damage Record Generation

h2. Context

The system should allow sending a Claim Form to the customer for completion and, upon submission, automatically generate a Damage Record with pre-populated details for the relevant vehicle. This is a high priority enhancement raised by Sajana Manandhar on 10/24/2025.

h2. Acceptance criteria

* System can send a Claim Form to the customer for completion.
* Upon customer submission, a new Damage Record is automatically created for the relevant vehicle.
* The Damage Record is pre-populated with the details provided by the customer in the Claim Form.
* The process is seamless and requires minimal manual intervention.

h2. Other information

Stakeholder feedback: Yes
Status: open.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: Enable Export of Vehicle Damage Details Including Notes and Attachments
column28:
h2. Summary

Enable Export of Vehicle Damage Details Including Notes and Attachments

h2. Context

There is a requirement to allow the system to export all recorded vehicle damage information, including notes and attachments, to support operational reporting, insurance processing, and record management. This task is marked as high priority and was raised by Sajana Manandhar on 10/24/2025.

h2. Acceptance criteria

* All vehicle damage records, including associated notes and attachments, can be exported from the system.
* Exported data is formatted for operational reporting, insurance processing, and record management.
* Export functionality is accessible to authorised users.

h2. Other information

Stakeholder feedback: Yes
Status: open.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: Implement Save Without Proceeding Functionality Across Operational Screens
column28:
h2. Summary

Implement Save Without Proceeding Functionality Across Operational Screens

h2. Context

The system currently requires users to complete all mandatory fields before saving entries. There is a need to allow users to save partial data entries on all operational screens without proceeding, enabling follow-up actions when complete information is not initially available. This enhancement is prioritised as high and was raised by Krizia Fontarum on 10/13/2025.

h2. Acceptance criteria

* Users can save incomplete or partial data entries on all operational screens without being forced to proceed to the next step.
* Saved partial entries can be retrieved and completed at a later time.
* The system clearly indicates which entries are incomplete or require additional information before final submission.
* No data is lost when saving partial entries.

h2. Other information

Status: open.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.

column1: After adding delivery slots when user clicks done - the pop-up window doesn't close
column28:
|After adding delivery slots when user clicks done - the pop-up window doesn't close.
The “cancel” button doesn’t do anything.
The “done” works the same logic as “add slot” button currently.
In general application, the following logics should apply: 
*“Cancel”*
* Discards any changes the user has made.
* Returns the user to the previous screen without saving.
* Essentially means _“undo and exit.”_
*“Done”*
* Saves any modifications the user has made.
* Confirms and applies the settings.
* Closes the settings screen once changes are saved.
!image-20251125-001453.png|width=823,alt="image-20251125-001453.png"!
!image-20251125-001510.png|width=821,alt="image-20251125-001510.png"!|

column1: Review and confirm audit log access for tracking user permission changes
column28:
h3. *Business Requirement*

The system shall provide audit log functionality that enables the review and tracking of all changes to user permissions. This includes the ability to identify who made the change, when it was made, and the nature of the change.

h3. *Rationale*

Tracking changes to user permissions is critical for maintaining system security, ensuring accountability, and supporting compliance with internal policies and regulatory requirements. Audit logs help prevent unauthorized access, enable investigation of anomalies, and provide transparency over system administration activities.

h3. *Acceptance Criteria*

# The system captures all changes to user permissions in an audit log.
# Each audit entry includes:
#* User who made the change
#* Timestamp of the change
#* Details of the change (added, removed, or modified permissions)
# Audit logs are easily accessible to authorized administrators for review.
# Audit logs are protected from modification or deletion by unauthorized users.

column1: Report and Dashboard is not showing non-revenue tasks.
column28:
h3. *Business Requirement*

The system shall provide reports and dashboard views that display the number of *non-revenue tasks* completed by each user over a user-selectable date range.

h3. *Rationale*

Visibility into non-revenue task activity enables management to better understand workload distribution, operational efficiency, and resource utilisation. This insight supports performance monitoring, capacity planning, and informed decision-making across branches and teams.

h3. *Acceptance Criteria*

# Reports and dashboards display non-revenue task counts per user.
# Users can select and modify the reporting date range.
# Data can be filtered by user and date range.
# Reported data accurately reflects completed non-revenue tasks only.
# Access to reports and dashboards is restricted to authorised users.
column663: Visibility into non-revenue task activity enables management to better understand workload distribution, operational efficiency, and resource utilisation. This insight supports performance monitoring, capacity planning, and informed decision-making across branches and teams.

column1: Invoicing - user can regenerate the invoice document multiple times; doesn't prevent invoice generation if rental is "on hold"
column28:
User is able to generate multiple invoices on the on-hold file even though the file is not ready for invoice - on-hold flag remains. 

When a rental is marked as on-hold, regardless the rental is closed or not, the invoice should not appear in the Invoice Ready page.
column786: User to check Ready to Invoice  page before generating invoice to ensure all rentals are closed (without on-hold flag) and ready for invoicing.
column790:
02/Dec/25 6:42 AM;5d230ed2f61f200c217433a0;We have disabled invoice generation when the status is “On Hold”, or when an invoice has already been generated, or when the rental has not yet ended.

!image-20251201-193830.png|width=535,alt="image-20251201-193830.png"!

Please check,

Thank you.
column791:
02/Dec/25 11:55 AM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:5d230ed2f61f200c217433a0] thanks for the update. 

We need the ability to be able to regenerate invoice even after it is completed. However, in this ticket, we don’t want the user to be able to generate/regenerate invoice when it is not ready.

In the meantime, [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] can you please help to test the rest?

column411:
*Given/When/Then (GWT) Format:* This is a structured and readable approach derived from Behavior-Driven Development (BDD).

# *Given:* The initial preconditions or state of the system.
# *When:* The specific action the user takes.
# *Then:* The expected outcome or observable result.

*Example:*

# *Given* I am on the product search page
# *When* I enter "wireless headphones" in the search bar and press enter
# *Then* A list of products matching the search term is displayed

11/Dec/25 7:01 AM;712020:82aa7e60-100a-49b7-b30b-11acd41a6056;Hi [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] [~accountid:5c8a70adee0f2d70e23c5f4a] [~accountid:712020:7094118d-ab93-4062-afab-998c5e20b781] 

We have completed the generate payment link request and created the endpoint to receive the credit card registration result, as described in the email we sent earlier, so you can now test from your side.


!image-20251210-193723.png|width=492,alt="image-20251210-193723.png"!



We’re currently working on processing the payment but when we call the Payments/ProcessPayment endpoint using the test data you provided in the documentation [https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1504575492/Fleet+System+to+Stripe+via+Boomi+Integration+Specifications|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1504575492/Fleet+System+to+Stripe+via+Boomi+Integration+Specifications|smart-link]  we receive the following error response:


!image-20251210-193315.png|width=463,alt="image-20251210-193315.png"!

Please provide the test data we can use in testing specially for process payment.

Separately, we have encountered an issue with the error response mentioned above that needs to be addressed by the Boomi development team. The API is currently returning an invalid JSON response. specifically, the values of the error_code and error_message fields are not enclosed in quotation marks.

That what we currently receive:
"error_code": resource_missing,
"error_message": No such PaymentMethod: 'pm_1234567890abcdef'

Should be:
"error_code": "resource_missing",
"error_message": "No such PaymentMethod: 'pm_1234567890abcdef'"

Kindly provide the required data and request the Boomi team to correct the response issue so that we can proceed.

column1: Missing indicator of "Write-off" in the invoicing process

# Date range
# Reservation Type
# Invoice Status
# Rental#
# Reservation#

column1: The system should not allow to reserve a vehicle that has a rental period (already on rent) or reservation period overlapping the intended reservation period.
column28:
The system should not allow to reserve a vehicle that has a rental period (already on rent) or reservation period overlapping the intended reservation period. This is violating the vehicle availability search logic.



Duplicate of action item # 88 [https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1465679883/11.1+Daily+Standup|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1465679883/11.1+Daily+Standup|smart-link]
column790:
13/Nov/25 9:39 AM;712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa;[~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b]  [~accountid:712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381] [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a]  - have retested and passed

||*Steps*||*Screenshot / Screen Recording*||*Status*||
|Opened a *Corporate Hire Melb172* and searched a vehicle that is under the cargo van vehicle type. Pick up date is 13/11/2025 and return date is 13/12/2025
\\
I tried to adjust another rental’s return date to have the return date to be 28/10/2025 (past date) but is still on hire.
* If the scenario is same as above the vehicle will be visible when searching as the system thinks that we can book the vehicle due to the return date being a past date.
\\
* Once I update the return date of *MR105* to 14/11/2025, and search the vehicle again for Melb172 I am UNABLE to see it now and unable to book|[^CIP-375 13.11.2025.webm]|*PASSED*
* This will require branch managers or admins to ensure that the return dates are updated accordingly to prevent people from booking on rent vehicles.|
