column791:
14/Nov/25 9:06 AM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:5c8a70adee0f2d70e23c5f4a] for manuel creation of Credit Reservation, I think we need to add a critical enhancement for removing the the mandatory rules for the following fields so that the file can be proceeded:

# Claim ID
# Source of Business
# Vehicle Type
column792:
15/Nov/25 1:16 AM;70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c;Hi [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] 

Please note that, based on the initial requirements we received and according to the Confluence Credit Page requirements:

[https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1471807492/1.4.4+Credit+Reservation|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FMS/pages/1471807492/1.4.4+Credit+Reservation]

Most fields on the Credit page are not editable, including:

Status

Claim ID

Source of Business

Referral Agency

Referral Agent

Vehicle Type

Delivery/Pickup Country

Return/Drop-off Country

Rate Plan Type

Daily Rate

Additionally, all Accident Details fields are mandatory and also non-editable:

!image-20251114-141417.png|width=464,alt="image-20251114-141417.png"!

!image-20251114-141450.png|width=464,alt="image-20251114-141450.png"!

Therefore, we need the complete requirements and the full scenario for creating a Credit reservation through the system.
column793:
17/Nov/25 11:08 AM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Hi [~accountid:70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c] Thanks for the details. You are correct that the original requirements for Credit reservation was only created via API and those mandatory fields should be populated via API. 

However, there was a critical request to also allow Credit reservation to be created manually and directly in the system couple of months ago. We would like to know if we prioritize this critical enhancement, what would be the efforts to implement and impacts on the fields and existing flow?

cc: [~accountid:712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381]
column794:
18/Nov/25 8:30 AM;70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c;Hi [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] 

To allow creating a credit reservation through the system, all required fields would need to be editable. However, this would also affect reservations coming from the API, since these fields would become editable and anyone could modify values originally set by the API.

Therefore, we need clarification on the expected scenario:

What should happen when creating a new credit reservation through the system?

What should happen when editing a reservation that was originally created through the API?
column795:
18/Nov/25 12:38 PM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;[~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] 
As per the original requirements and the current system configuration, Credit Reservations can only be created via the API (Reclaim). Any attempt to create a Credit Reservation manually is therefore expected to fail and should not be considered a valid defect. An enhancement request will be required if we need to reassess this behaviour.

[~accountid:712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381] 
Could you please help us understand the potential impact on the API if these fields were to be made editable and/or non-mandatory?
column796:
18/Nov/25 3:51 PM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;[~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b]  When a credit reservation is created via the API, all existing rules must apply — for example, any non-editable fields must remain non-editable.

When a credit reservation is created via the UI (which the system can detect because the creation is initiated through the UI), the mandatory fields should be editable during the creation process. Once the credit reservation is saved, the standard behaviour should resume — meaning that when the credit hire record is subsequently viewed or edited, any fields that are normally non-editable should again become non-editable.  After the credit reservation is saved, the system will trigger a webhook to Reclaim, which will return the CID. This CID must then be synced back to the RC UI.
column797:
18/Nov/25 3:58 PM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;Thanks [~accountid:712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381] 

[~accountid:70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c] Can this be addressed as a critical enhancement for making the mandatory fields editable as per Shiela’s explaination below? Or what would be the effort? I will bring this up with [~accountid:5c8a70adee0f2d70e23c5f4a]
column798:
19/Nov/25 8:54 AM;70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c;[~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b] [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] [~accountid:712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381] [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] 

This has been completed, and you can now create credit reservations through the system, as shown in the following snapshots:

!image-20251118-215338.png|width=656,alt="image-20251118-215338.png"!



!image-20251118-214919.png|width=656,alt="image-20251118-214919.png"!

!image-20251118-214948.png|width=656,alt="image-20251118-214948.png"!

And when editing the reservation, the fields become disabled again as requested.

!image-20251118-215132.png|width=656,alt="image-20251118-215132.png"!
column799:
19/Nov/25 4:43 PM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;thanks, [~accountid:70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c] 

Now that credit hire records can be created manually through the UI, and a _Claim ID_ is still mandatory, users can enter a “_temporary Claim ID_” until the valid one is generated in Reclaim (e.g. screenshot below Claim ID = ‘CID’)

However, once a manually created credit hire record is saved, the _Claim ID_ field becomes non-editable when the record is reopened. This prevents users from updating it with the correct Claim ID (from Reclaim).

To resolve this, an _admin_ should have the ability to override the non-editable state of the _Claim ID_ field. This would allow the _admin_ to update the field once the correct Claim ID becomes available, ensuring it is synchronised with Reclaim.



!image-20251119-053807.png|width=887,alt="image-20251119-053807.png"!





cc: [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b]  [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa]  [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a]
column800:
20/Nov/25 8:23 AM;70121:aa6b385e-c582-463a-accc-238cc59fa71c;[~accountid:712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381] [~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555] [~accountid:712020:13591975-f53d-475c-bb72-248a5decf24a] [~accountid:615f7778289a54006a3add9b]  

This has been done:

If the admin doesn’t have the permission “Edit Claim ID“, the “claim ID” field will be disabled:

!image-20251119-212004.png|width=656,alt="image-20251119-212004.png"!

!image-20251119-212100.png|width=656,alt="image-20251119-212100.png"!

And if the admin has that permission, the “Claim ID “ field will be enabled:

!image-20251119-212236.png|width=656,alt="image-20251119-212236.png"!

!image-20251119-212258.png|width=656,alt="image-20251119-212258.png"!
column801:
25/Nov/25 11:30 AM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;This works now.  For credit, when reservation channel = ‘API - Reclaim’, it does not allow CID edit even if admin has ‘Edit Claim Id’ permission - since value is already coming from Reclaim.  But when reservation channel <>  ‘API - Reclaim’, which means that the reservation is manually created, it then allows the admin to update the CID.

column796:
18/Nov/25 2:53 PM;712020:87cb2a66-52ac-416f-828a-b715b9cfe381;Hi[~accountid:712020:82aa7e60-100a-49b7-b30b-11acd41a6056] as you added _agreeId_ and _customerid_ for inbound messages - please add those ones as well to the outbound messages - as there is no way for inbound messages to get the agreeid and customerid values without RC sending them before hand.



+_SMS outbound payload (RC to SMS) :_+ [https://gtw-uat.movigo.com.au:443/ws/rest/webservice/MessageMedia/|https://gtw-uat.movigo.com.au:443/ws/rest/webservice/MessageMedia/]

{
"content":"Rental AKL_Rent_",
"destination_number":"61425608541",
"refCaseID1":"104",
"refCaseID2":"AKL_Rent_1",
"brand":"R2D-RentCentric",
"PrimaryCustomer_country":"Australia",


/* agreeid and and customerid needs to be added so MessageMedia can keep these details and use it to populate inbound attributes */
*"agreeId": 151,*
*"customerId":341,*
}



Also, can you pls add this SMS outbound webhook in Settings > Integrations > Webhook Setup?

cc : [~accountid:6195e625f241500072581555]  [~accountid:712020:a918d2b9-2841-4971-89e7-1bdb32217bef]

column1: Cannot add Additional Driver details on mobile apps
column28:
Additional Driver data in mobile apps is different from what we have added to the system. 

The Additional Driver details and features of the web platform should align with the mobile applications so that user can add/remove additional drivers via the mobile applications during delivery. 



Impacts:

# Poor user and customer experience
# Adds time in delivery and can block delivery



Comment from Rentcentric
This requires customizations to the apps after white labelling.



!image-20251106-002534.png|width=220,alt="image-20251106-002534.png"!
column786: Use web platform to update details.

column1: Define record locking rules for Reservations & Rentals and other screens across the system
column28:
Action Items#32

This requires discussion with Alex as per Tamer.

This needs to be done before UAT commences to avoid clashes between users' activities. 

Requirements: [https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/WABLWQ|https://movigo.atlassian.net/wiki/x/WABLWQ|smart-link]
column790:
11/Nov/25 11:19 AM;615f7778289a54006a3add9b;This update must be implemented *prior to the commencement of UAT* to prevent potential conflicts arising from multiple users accessing the same records simultaneously.

As discussed with Alex and [~accountid:5c8a70adee0f2d70e23c5f4a] , the original record-locking mechanism presents significant challenges. The following alternative solution is therefore proposed:

# When a user is actively working on a file, and a second user attempts to access the same record, a *popup notification* should appear informing the second user that the file is currently being edited by another user (displaying the *User ID*) and cannot be modified until it is released.
# Once the file has been unlocked, if the second user is still viewing the record, they must *refresh or re-enter the page* before any edits can be made.
# The *System Administrator* should have the ability to *manually unlock records* that have remained locked beyond a defined period of inactivity. This ensures operational continuity and prevents disruptions caused by abandoned or stale sessions.

This rule should apply at a minimum to the following modules:

* *Reservation*
* *Rental* (linked to Reservation for locking)

column1: Call routing and scripting database
column28:
The current database for call flows is a sharepoint that has become outdated. It also requires lots of material to be referenced as you read through the flows.

We require a comprehensive database that shows call flows, where prompts and TTS are played and what is said so that there is an accurate visual for each call flow that can be called upon when required.

There is a piece of software called ‘Uplinx’ that can read call flows directly from Amazon connect that could be used but there is a cost for this.

Once the Amazon connect cleanse is complete we will understand the number of active call flows and understand the extent of effort required to properly map and maintain them, based on this we can make a decision as to whether the task is manageable in house or whether an alternative solution is required.
column411:
*Given* I am a customer

*When* I enter option 1 on the R2D Main Line IVR

*Then* I am put through to the Customer Ops team


*Given* I am a customer

*When* I enter option 2 on the R2D Main Line IVR

*Then* I am put through to the Customer Ops team



*Given* I am a customer

*When* I enter option 3 on the R2D Main Line IVR

*Then* I am put through to NRMA



*Given* I am a customer

*When* I enter option 4 on the R2D Main Line IVR

*Then* I am put through to Local Ops


*Given* I am a customer

*When* I enter option 0 on the R2D Main Line IVR

*Then* I am put through to the Customer Ops team



*Given* I am a customer

*When* I enter an invalid option on the IVR

*Then* I am advised and asked to select a correct option



*Given* I am a customer

*When* I do not enter an IVR option

*Then* I am advised and asked to select an option



*Given* a customer selects options 1, 2 or 0

*When* they are transferred to the customer ops team

*Then* the call is routed to the file handler listed in Reclaim if they are available



*Given* a customer selects options 4

*When* they are transferred to the Local Ops team

*Then* the call is routed to the branch listed in Reclaim



*Given* a customer calls

*When* they repeatedly select an invalid IVR option

*Then* after 3 oppourtunities the call ends

*Given* a customer calls

*When* they repeatedly do not select an IVR option

*Then* after 3 oppourtunities the call ends

*Given* a customer calls

*When* they hear the IVR options

*Then* they are spoken clearly in English

*Given* a customer calls between 5pm and 7pm

*When* they select option 4

*Then* I am put through to the Customer Ops Team



*Given* an IVR option is selected

*When* the customer is placed on hold

*Then* the hold pattern they hear is the same as the existing call flow

*Given* a new call is coming through

*When* the call is answered

*Then* the user is advised of the IVR option that was selected for example ‘New Application’

*Given* a new call comes in

*When* outside the hours of operation

*Then* the existing after hours process is followed

column1: CustomerOps Reclaim Dashboard
column28:
Add *booking service* in Customer Ops Performance Dashboard (All tabs) 

Reclaim enhancement deployed dd.  24 July for Standard Booking Services. 

New reclaim protocol: Once Claims approved files for booking, it goes to a new state under *Book Services* status and file gets allocated to agents via DFA. 

New info available in Reclaim: 

* Date/time standard file was approved by claims
* Date/time booking reqt was allocated to the agent
* Date/time booking was confirmed
* Name of the agent who processed the booking confirmation 
* File Action: Book Services

column1: Call Routing - IVR Review and update
column28:
The currnt IVR options has multiple levels and complexity that results in a poor customer journey, marketing and customer ops would like a better IVR option list to increase call retention and improve the customer experiance.

*As a* customer

*I want* to speak with an agent quickly

*So that* I don’t have to spend time sat on hold

*As a* customer

*I want* simple IVR options

*So that* I can understand them



*As a* customer

*I want* simple IVR options

*So that* I can understand them



*As a* customer

*I want* simple IVR options

*So that* I can understand them


*As a* Customer Ops Manager

*I want* calls routed to the correct file handler

*So that* the call is with the most appropriate user


*As a* Local Ops Manager

*I want* calls routed to the relevant branch

*So that* the call is with the most appropriate user

*As a* customer

*I want* IVR options to be spoken clearly

*So that* I can understand them



*As a* customer

*I want* the call to be answered when I select an IVR option

*So that* I can have a good experiance

*As a* user

*I want* to hear a whisper advising what the call is about

*So that* I can know what the caller wants to speak about
column411:
*Given* I am a customer

*When* I enter option 1 on the R2D Main Line IVR

*Then* I am put through to the Customer Ops team


*Given* I am a customer

*When* I enter option 2 on the R2D Main Line IVR

*Then* I am put through to the Customer Ops team



*Given* I am a customer

*When* I enter option 3 on the R2D Main Line IVR

*Then* I am put through to NRMA



*Given* I am a customer

*When* I enter option 4 on the R2D Main Line IVR

*Then* I am put through to Local Ops


*Given* I am a customer

*When* I enter option 0 on the R2D Main Line IVR

*Then* I am put through to the Customer Ops team



*Given* I am a customer

*When* I enter an invalid option on the IVR

*Then* I am advised and asked to select a correct option



*Given* I am a customer

*When* I do not enter an IVR option

*Then* I am advised and asked to select an option



*Given* a customer selects options 1, 2 or 0

*When* they are transferred to the customer ops team

*Then* the call is routed to the file handler listed in Reclaim if they are available



*Given* a customer selects options 4

*When* they are transferred to the Local Ops team

*Then* the call is routed to the branch listed in Reclaim



*Given* a customer calls

*When* they repeatedly select an invalid IVR option

*Then* after 3 oppourtunities the call ends

*Given* a customer calls

*When* they repeatedly do not select an IVR option

*Then* after 3 oppourtunities the call ends

*Given* a customer calls

*When* they hear the IVR options

*Then* they are spoken clearly in English

*Given* a customer calls between 5pm and 7pm

*When* they select option 4

*Then* I am put through to the Customer Ops Team



*Given* an IVR option is selected

*When* the customer is placed on hold

*Then* the hold pattern they hear is the same as the existing call flow

*Given* a new call is coming through

*When* the call is answered

*Then* the user is advised of the IVR option that was selected for example ‘New Application’

*Given* a new call comes in

*When* outside the hours of operation

*Then* the existing after hours process is followed

column1: Review Streamlined UI
column28: Review the attached streamlined Rental UI and advise of any suggested improvements to layout.
column790:
04/Jun/25 2:51 PM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;[~accountid:712020:896fbf33-ebe0-4512-a8b9-a84a13cd935a] I have reviewed and have the following feedback.

In the first section I sort of semi split the customers information using spacing into the following sections:

# Details (Name and DOB)
# Address
# Licence Info

Whereas Rentcentric have them all jumbled together, both work but I think mine is easier on the eye.

Remaining spacing is ok but needs refining.

* They have left out the ‘location’ and ‘pickup locations’ fields, not sure if that is correct or not to be honest.
* They have left in the ‘Rate’ field which is not needed
* 'Vehicle Type' is missing
* The vehicle information is not in line with any other field
* 'Other charges' section is missing entirely

column1: Customer Transactional Survey
column28:
*As a* Customer

*I want* a short survey

*So that* it does not take too long



*As an* manager

*I want* feedback from customers

*So that* I can improve the customer experience


*As an* manager

*I want* only from customers

*So that* data quality is high


*As an* manager

*I want* the survey to be provided on all calls

*So that* we gather sufficient data
column51: Confluence page and acceptance criteria;03/Jun/25 10:19 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;3600
column411:
*Given* I am a customer

*When* I agree to complete the customer survey

*Then* I am only asked 3 questions



*Given* I am a R2D ops manager

*When* I want to review feedback from our customers

*Then* I have access to reporting on the customer survey to review



*Given* I am an R2D ops agent

*When* I am speaking to a party who is not our customer

*Then* I have the option to not allow them to complete the survey



*Given* I am an R2D ops agent

*When* I complete any call

*Then* I have the option to trigger the customer survey



*Given* I am a R2D ops manager

*When* a customer has only partially completed the survey

*Then* I am still able to view their answers to the questions

column1: Wrap up code review and tailoring
column28:
*As a* front end user

*I want* to only see wrap up codes relevant to my role

*So that* I can easily find the wrap up code I need


*As a* front end user

*I want* all available wrap up codes displayed to me clearly

*So that* it is easy to find the one I need


*As a* manager

*I want* users to be able to select a wrap up code quickly

*So that* they are available for a call sooner


*As a* manager

*I want* clear reporting to show what wrap up codes are being used

*So that* I can understand the nature of calls that my team is receiving


*As a* front end user

*I want* different wrap up codes based on whether the call is inbound or outbound

*So that* the relevant wrap up codes are displayed



*As a* front end user

*I want* the wrap up code UI to be well designed

*So that* it is easy to use

column1: Amazon connect audit
column28:
A full audit of Amazon connect is required to ensure that is operating smoothly, currently it is clear that it has not been maintained.

We have conducted a review of users removing a substantial number of former employees and a retirement of phone numbers with our total going from 117 numbers to 44.

What is required is an experienced eye to review how we have Amazon set up and provide feedback on how it can be made more efficient, IXceed advised Jody that call flow quality should be reviewed.

*Areas to consider*

# Review of Active numbers to ensure that all are required
# Review of active routing profiles to ensure they are in use
# Review of call flows to ensure they are in use
# Rebuild quick connects options
# Create Documentation detailing:
## All numbers
## Call flows for each number
## IVR scripting
column411:
*Given/When/Then (GWT) Format:* This is a structured and readable approach derived from Behavior-Driven Development (BDD).

# *Given:* The initial preconditions or state of the system.
# *When:* The specific action the user takes.
# *Then:* The expected outcome or observable result.

*Example:*

# *Given* I am on the product search page
# *When* I enter "wireless headphones" in the search bar and press enter
# *Then* A list of products matching the search term is displayed

Once we have this data I can put to gether a plan to close disused numbers and redirect where required.

column1: Rejection & Cancellation Guidelines
column28:
When analysing the cancellation where agents as tagging the reasons incorrectly we need to provide clearer guidelines.

# Do we have a *guideline* regarding cancellation vs rejection?
# What merits a cancellation? - might be covered in the doc Leni shared (intro to R2D) might need to update to match the reasons in Reclaim?
# What merits a rejection?
# We have *"Has access to another vehicle"* both under cancellation and rejection - how do we differentiate this?
# Do we need the same reason in both cancellation and rejection, or can we use a different terminology as to not confuse agents?
#  If customer *owns* a spare vehicle that they can use - would this be rejected or cancelled?
# If customer, then resorted to borrowing a vehicle from a friend and contact is *outside* of our SLA would this be cancelled or rejected?
column790: 22/May/25 1:52 PM;712020:6d5be3ca-4884-420c-ac52-f861ceb6cd4f;A short Job Aid Guideline to be created so that the team have clarity on choosing Rejection V Cancellation where it applies. A meeting will be held tomorrow 23/5/25 to discuss this, the job will be ready by early next week. At this time there is no clear document which goes over Rejection and Cancellation clearly and an explanation of whats in the drop down in Reclaim.

column1: Wrap up code review and tailoring
column28:
Currently al Right2Drive team recieve the same wrap up code options at the end of a call, this is comprised of 44 options that cover all required options for all teams.

This presents a two problems:

* Allowing all options for all teams risks data integrity as teams can select the wrong code
* Having 44 options means that teams need to search longer for the correct option

On top of the above the codes seem to be either outdated or inefficient such as ‘Branch Call’ which acts as a catch all for any branch call, this lessens data qualitly.

column1: Eligibility Check - Amber scenarios - Job Aid + Business Rules
column28:
Creation of detailed business rules for assessment and validation of Amber (medium risk) application onboarding.

Task includes definition of rules to assess amber criteria across driver, vehicle, accident details.  Rules will be codified and used to ensure applications are assessed quickly and consistently, with minimal need to refer to a TL or Manager for approval.

Once rules are defined processes and JA will be created to be used by Ops and Claims teams.

Business rules will be defined and owned by Claims and Recoveries managers.

column1: Local Ops call routing
column28:
*As a* manager

*I want* the operations coordinator to handle inbound calls

*So that* customers speak with the best placed person to assist them



*-As an-* -claims operator-

*-I want-* -an SMS sent to the customer asking them to organise the return of our vehicle based on the expected completion date of repairs-

*-So that-* -the customer is prompted to organise the return of the R2D vehicle automatically-



*As a* customer

*I want* to speak with the correct person as soon as possible

*So that* I do not have to spend a long time on the phone



*-As an-* -local ops team member-

*-I want-* -fleet damage calls routed to fleet-

*-So that-* -I do not have to deal with them-



*As an* operations coordinator

*I want* calls that cannot be answered to go to voicemail

*So that* the customer can provide details and we can return their call



*As an* executive

*I want* branch performance in respect to telephony reported on

*So that* we can see who performs well and who does not



*As an* site lead

*I want* the telephony system to be updated when there are public holidays

*So that* we do not miss calls



*-As an-* -operations coordinator-

*-I want-* -customer to be able to book a return using the telephony system-

*-So that-* -the customer can service themselves-



*-As a-* -manager-

*-I want-* -the phone to ring so that it can be heard throughout the branch (within reason)-

*-So that-* -staff are aware there is a phone call that may need to be answered-

*-As a-* -manager-

*-I want-* -all branch staff to be able to answer the phone-

*-So that-* -anyone can answer the phone and assist a customer-
column411:
*Given* there is an inbound call to a local ops number

*When* the call is received

*Then* it is directed to the Operations Coordinator as the first priority



*Given* I am a customer

*When* I call the branch

*Then* I am directed to the branch to handle my query



*Given* the Operations Coordinator is on a call

*When* a new call is received

*Then* the call is directed to the site lead to answer



*Given* the Operations Coordinator and site lead are on a call

*When* a new call is received

*Then* the call is directed to the back up Operations Coordinator



*Given* the Operations Coordinator, Site Lead and backup Operations Coordinator are on a call

*When* a new call is received

*Then* the call is directed to the back up Site Lead



*Given* the Operations Coordinator, Site Lead, backup Operations Coordinator and backup Site Lead are on a call

*When* a new call is received

*Then* the call is directed to voicemail after 60 seconds



*Given* a voicemail message has been left

*When* an email is sent to advise of this

*Then* it goes to the correct branch inbox as per the confluence page



*Given* I am the manager of local ops

*When* reviewing the performance of my team

*Then* I have access to data to measure how well they have performed



*Given* I am the manager of local ops

*When* there is a public holiday

*Then* I am able to update the telephony system have a small number of staff assigned to all lines



*Given* I call a branch line

*When* the call is received

*Then* I am directed to the appropriate line



*Given* a call is received for a line with multiple branches

*When* the call is received

*Then* a whisper is played to the user to advise what branch the call is for



*Given* a call is received by a back up agent

*When* the call is received

*Then* a whisper is played to the user to advise what branch the call is for



*Given* a call is received after hours

*When* the call is received

*Then* the customer is advised the line is closed and directed to voicemail



*Given* I am Local Ops Manager

*When* it is the weekend

*Then* I am able to update the telephony system have a small number of staff assigned to all lines



*Given* I call the R2D Main Line

*When* I select ‘Accident in a R2D vehicle’

*Then* there is a system in place to direct the call to the correct local ops line



*Given* I call the integrity wheelchair line

*When* I select ‘Accident in a R2D vehicle’

*Then* there is a system in place to direct the call to the correct local ops line



*Given* I call the R2D Main Line

*When* I select ‘Bike’

*Then* I am not able to get through to local ops



*Given* I make an outbound call as a local ops agent

*When* the call is recived by the public

*Then* the relevant branch number is displayed as the ‘calling’ number
column790:
15/Apr/25 10:53 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;Spoke with Ben Rouse regarding requirements around overflow to site lead and booking a return using IVR

Overflow to site lead would have only been viable in the scenario where we route calls to mobiles which we decided was not a good option due to the likelihood of lost information, as such I have removed that user story.

I also asked about the viability of booking a return using IVR and due to the nature of information required when organising a return this may prove difficult, branch require the following

* Date
* Time
* Location
* File Number

They also advise return T’s and C’s.

Date, time and file number can be done using the phone keypad and location could be done using voice recognition but this does present a lot of opportunity for error and could be quite lengthy, language barriers also present a potential problem. I have struck through the user story for now.

cc [~accountid:712020:896fbf33-ebe0-4512-a8b9-a84a13cd935a] [~accountid:712020:19c9fbf8-8942-4a6a-b36a-c819be1e1dcf]
column791:
15/Apr/25 10:56 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;After talking further with Ben a requirement that plays a large role in this enhancement request has been brought to light.

An incoming call alert to Amazon connect in branch is not very loud, there is a visual prompt and a ring tone but the ring tone is quiet and may go though a users headset/headphones. This is the reason that Ben has had to roster people to sit at the desk so the phone can be heard.

There is usually at least one person at a branch at any given time that can answer the phone, we just need to make sure that the phone can be heard.

Branch get around 54 calls a day across all branches with is about 3 per branch per day however someone has to watch the phone in case it rings. (see attached spreadsheet)

Ensuring people can hear the phone ringing without having to sit at the desk and answer without needing to be logged into a laptop will greatly reduce the impact of this issue and mean that all staff can assist in answering calls.

cc [~accountid:712020:896fbf33-ebe0-4512-a8b9-a84a13cd935a] [~accountid:712020:19c9fbf8-8942-4a6a-b36a-c819be1e1dcf]
column792:
15/Apr/25 2:36 PM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;I have spent time at the Seven Hills branch with Sasha, she logged in for 2 hours and received 5 calls, 2 were returns 1 was a repair update that should have gone to claims and 2 other calls were from the same regarding a termination that was also meant for claims.

I spoke further with Sasha and Ben regarding the use of Amazon connect and this supported the ideas I had of the limitations in place using Amazon connect, someone must be logged in to a laptop with Amazon connect to answer the phone, being away from the desk means calls will likely be missed.

I remember long ago that branch used landlines which suited the environment as it meant whoever was free/best placed to answer the phone could, Amazon connect was preferred however due to its performance monitoring capabilities. It seems to me the best options is something with the freedom of use of a landline with the performance monitoring of AC

I reached out to Joemar at ixceed and explained to him what I was thinking and he advised that we would need to check with their solutions architect and they will arrange a meeting for next Wednesday with Jody and Alister in my stead.

cc [~accountid:712020:19c9fbf8-8942-4a6a-b36a-c819be1e1dcf] [~accountid:712020:896fbf33-ebe0-4512-a8b9-a84a13cd935a]
column793:
07/May/25 9:03 AM;70121:628e6b8f-b54a-4b91-8b26-2b9d3fae50a4;[~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88] you can share below with team, hope these can solve some issues. 

# Allow the Notification settings for the Amazon Connect site in the browser’s site settings. It will trigger a incoming call alert/pop-up at the right bottom of the laptop 
!image-20250506-225255.png|width=635,height=504,alt="image-20250506-225255.png"!
# Log in as the Desk Phone when the ops needs to go away from the computer. The incoming call will be forwarded to the phone number entered. The call should still be recorded in this way. 

!image-20250506-225708.png|width=291,height=497,alt="image-20250506-225708.png"!

# Agent can also log in their Amazon Connect via the mobile browser if they cannot access their computer. The only supported mobile browser I found so far is *Firefox*.  If users use this way, they need to change their mobile phone settings to make sure the broswer to be running the back end all the time to avoided disconnecting from the internet. 

CC: [~accountid:712020:896fbf33-ebe0-4512-a8b9-a84a13cd935a] [~accountid:712020:19c9fbf8-8942-4a6a-b36a-c819be1e1dcf]
column794:
12/May/25 9:20 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;[~accountid:70121:628e6b8f-b54a-4b91-8b26-2b9d3fae50a4] thanks for the below information. I think most local ops users are receving the incoming call notifications ok and using Amazon connect while on the move is somthing we want to avoid to prevent lost infomation however point 2 is very interesting as it looks like it could achieve the solution we are after.


* If users log in as a desk phone can any number be used as the forwarding number?
* Once the call is forwarded will it still be recorded?

column1: Lead Value Analysis Report
column28:
This report will enable us to Analyse both Lead sources and Referrers to establish if they are profitabile for Right2Drive.

The idea is that we review data showing all referrals from the relevant sources and take into account lead fee’s paid, COG’s, Invoice total, Settlement amount and Write off. With this information we can gauge which lead sources and referrers have a positive impact and which need to be reviewed.

column795:
23/May/25 12:20 PM;712020:97506884-5394-4df6-9980-ffcdff5a59a3;Another update for 2 pendings field:


# *Least cost per vehicle per day*  - can use NETSUITE as source data.  Deepak Bhardwaj gives me the calculation and mapping.  Can be mapped in reclaim using the Unit # of vehicle thru TSD and get the RANUMBER.

*FORMULA*:  
       Lease cost per day  = Total Lease Payment / ((Lease end Date - Lease Start Date) +1)
 
Sample screenshot:

!image-20250523-021023.png|width=97.98884811465318%,alt="image-20250523-021023.png"!


2. *Lead Fee Paid* - can use NETSUITE as source data. Carlito Obejera gives us the source mapping location snapshot but has 2 different source.

Updates:

1. *Least cost per vehicle per day*  - can use NETSUITE as source data.  Deepak Bhardwaj gives me the calculation and mapping.  Can be mapped in reclaim using the Unit # of vehicle thru TSD and get the RANUMBER.

       Lease cost per day  = Total Lease Payment / ((Lease end Date - Lease Start Date) +1)

However I have reviewed the prototype and have some feedback

*Net Income Column is missing*
This is a calculation field for each referral:

Invoice total - Write off - Lead Fee - Cost of goods/lease = Net Income

!image-20250717-055822.png|width=1549,height=461,alt="image-20250717-055822.png"!

*Cost of Goods/Lease*
The lease cost per day only seems to be capturing for some files, it should be present on all files where we have provided a vehicle which should be the majority of the data. 

The lease cost in the report is for the day and does not calculate to show the entire vehicle costs over each rental period which we would need to track profitability against each referral.

If we are not able to show the costs of goods/lease for the entire rental for each referral then perhaps we should omit this data either from the ‘Net Income’ calculation or from the report altogether and take into account where required using another method.

*All Others*
Canclled and rejected look good though a little light on data I will let Nic review that and advise.

FYI [~accountid:62f5c74b50bd9783f62dd73d] feel free to add your 2 cents

column1: Call Recognition/Routing to file handler
column28:
There are a number of points being made around recognising a call based on the inbound number and how that can help either direct the call or trigger an appropriate response/behaviour.

* Can we route calls to the appropriate team based on the master status of a file and the phone number the call is from?
* Can we route calls to the appropriate user based on the master status and file handler of a file and the phone number the call is from
* Can we route a call based on users skillset
** Routes calls to best placed user
* Can we route to user who is best placed to answer phone call such as the most recent user to action the file, but then route to team if the initial user is not available
** Benefit of this would be reduced handle time as users are familiar with the file
* Can we direct to branch based on IVR option/number called and Branch listed in Reclaim
* If user is not available give customer option to leave voicemail or speak with another operator
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663: Better call routing based on information we have is ideal as it would send customers direct to the user/team they require and customising the experience for repairer's could improve their opinion of us.

column1: Ops hold pattern
column28:
*As an* ops manager

*I want* hold music and marketing messages to play while a customer is on hold

*So that* they have something to listen to while holding



*As a* marketing person

*I want* hold music and marketing messages to play for 3 minutes before a Virtual hold is offered

*So that* if a customer is on hold for a while the hold pattern is not too repetitive



{color:#ff991f}*As a* {color}{color:#ff991f}customer{color}

{color:#ff991f}*I want* {color}{color:#ff991f}to know my position in the call queue{color}

{color:#ff991f}*So that* {color}{color:#ff991f}I know how long I have to wait{color}



*-As a-* -customer-

*-I want-* -to know the potential wait time-

*-So that-* -I know how long I have to wait-



*As a* customer

*I want* to be able to go on virtual hold

*So that* I do not have to stay on the phone to keep my place in the queue



*As a* customer

*I want* the ability to schedule a call back at a different time

*So that* I can receive a call back when I am available



*As an* ops manager

*I want* calls back windows to only be during the week between 8:30am and 5pm

*So that* we can ensure we have the resources to complete them



*As an* ops manager

*I want* 2 call back slots per 30 minute period

*So that* we can ensure we have the resources to complete them



*As an* ops manager

*I want* the customer to be advised of the closest available call back window if theirs in not available

*So that* the customer does not have to blindly keep trying



*As an* ops manager

*I want* a call back to route to the file handler if possible

*So that* the customer is connected to the relevant person



*As an* ops manager

*I want* an SMS to be sent calls abandoned after 4 seconds offering them the option to organise a call back

*So that* we have a chance to call them back



*As an* ops manager

*I want* virtual hold calls that are not completed to be treated as abandoned

*So that* continue to try and contact the customer



*As an* ops manager

*I want* to see reports that show the success of virtual hold and callbacks

*So that* we can adjust our strategy to improve performance
column411:
*Given* a customer has called

*When* they are on hold

*Then* they are advised of their queue position -and potential wait time-



*Given* a customer has called

*When* they decide to continue to hold

*Then* they are played hold music and played marketing messages that are on a 3 minute loop



*Given* a customer has called

*When* the hold period starts

*Then* they are offered the option of a virtual hold, scheduled call back or to continue holding



*Given* a customer has gone on virtual hold

*When* they hang up their phone

*Then* their queue position is maintained



*Given* a customer is organising a callback

*When* they are selecting their call back time

*Then* they are only able to book times between 8:30am and 5pm



*Given* a customer is organising a callback

*When* they are selecting their call back time

*Then* only two callbacks can be booked per 30 minute time slot



*Given* a customer is organising a callback

*When* the time slot they want is fully booked

*Then* the customer is advised of the next available time slot



*Given* a call to a customer is initiated

*When* selecting what user to route the call to

*Then* Amazon will integrate with Reclaim to route the call to the file handler if possible



*Given* a customer hangs up

*When* they have been on hold for 10 seconds or longer

*Then* an SMS should be sent to the caller asking if they would like to organise a callback



*Given* we are calling back a virtual hold customer

*When* the call is not connected

*Then* the call is treated as abandoned and added to the abandoned call queue



*Given* this enhancement is in place

*When* a manager is viewing Amazon connect

*Then* they are able to generate a report to measure the success of the new hold procedure

column1: Customer Transactional Survey (CTS / CSAT)
column28:
CTS is a feedback tool used immediately after a customer interaction to assess satisfaction with that specific experience.

Delivery method: Interactive Voice Response (IVR) 

Timing: Right after the call to capture immediate feedback

*CF: Agent to secure customer’s consent to participate in the survey >> transfer to the survey system.*   

Question 1: On a scale of 0 to 9, how likely are you to recommend Right2Drive to your friends or family?

Question 2: On a scale of 0 to 9, how would you rate the service quality of the agent who assisted you today? 

Question 3 (optional): Voice of the customer    

**Need Marketing’s inputs and approval**

column663:
* Maximizes agent productivity (less idle time)
* Improve agent utilisation and efficiency as it filters out VMs, busy signals, and disconnected numbers
* Eliminates waiting in queues as it calls were placed only when an agent is available
* Allows customers to schedule callbacks (reduce frustrations of unexpected calls)
* Look at integrating pre-call SMS. 
* Preview Dial: Allow the agent to review the lead before dialing out
column790: 05/Jun/25 11:05 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;Spoke with [~accountid:712020:19c9fbf8-8942-4a6a-b36a-c819be1e1dcf] to get clarity on requirements, they are not quite clear so Jody will regroup and we will reconvene on Monday
column791:
11/Jun/25 10:11 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;Reviewed requirements with [~accountid:712020:19c9fbf8-8942-4a6a-b36a-c819be1e1dcf] to confirm requirements and this enhancement is no longer required.

An outbound dialler for R2D leads does not quite work, as we are dialling out it is fair to expect our customers to expect the agent to be up to speed on the file when the call is answered. This means that the agent would require time to review the file before calling, allowing time for this is basically the as is process today.

An outbound dialler may be required in the future for non-brand leads but until that process is in full swing this enhancement is closed.

column1: Data from Amazon to Reclaim
column28:
Want to understand if it is possible to track the success of marketing campaigns through unique phone numbers and integration with Amazon connect and Reclaim.

There is the intention to increase the visibility of Right2dDrive, as such Marketing want to track what campaign methods are effective, they are toying with the idea of having a unique phone number for each campaign so that can be used to track incoming calls, this data is then to be fed into Reclaim so that the effectiveness of a campaign can be reported on.

We need to investigate potential solutions that do not result in the creation of a unique phone number for each customer.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663: We need to track the success of marketing campaigns while also keeping our telephony practices grounded and simple.
column790: 03/Jun/25 1:12 PM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;Confirmed with [~accountid:630ff7b562fe1e6eac6c5987] that this enhancement is no longer required.

column1: Phone number audit
column28:
We currently have quite a few numbers that customers can call.

There are numbers from each branch, each team, as well as others such as CRC and TAMMS.

Ben raised a good point in the recent workshop that we should have 1 R2D number for customers to call and the appropriate IVR in place to direct to teams, while this may  not be possible an audit of all numbers and where they can go will highlight inefficiencies.

We should also take this opportunity to ensure that when dialing out from any of the numbers we review what appears on the users phone as it has been reported that ‘suspected scam’ among other unfavourable titles are being displayed.

Call number masking to ensure that when we make an outbound call that the caller appears as Right2Drive
column48: Began review of list of all phone numbers to split by department;26/May/25 10:09 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;1200
column49: Reviewing phone numbers by team and organising meetings with leaders to determine what numbers can be shut down;26/May/25 1:43 PM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;7200
column54: Meetings, data gathering and users story;27/May/25 11:33 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;5400
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663:
Lots of access points to the call flow are hard to manage and will likely result in users following a trail of breadcrumbs, streamlining our phone system is key to improving the customer experience.

Ensuring that we have minimal numbers and that ‘Right2Drive’ is shown is the caller on users devices will result in a higher call answer rate.
column790:
02/Apr/25 10:09 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;[~accountid:712020:19c9fbf8-8942-4a6a-b36a-c819be1e1dcf] confirmed:

* Google numbers for branch are not consistent with R2D website

We need to ensure that numbers are consistent and we need to pick a number and stick with it, ideally something memorable customers can easily recall.
column791:
03/Apr/25 10:20 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;Have confirmed with Yogesh that marketing are using infinity call tracking to assist in improving google ad performance, this causes a different number to appear on the R2D website each time, when it is called the number redirects to the correct 1300 089 121.

Personally I think this detracts from a ‘mainstay’ number that the public could remember and makes it difficult for them to call us back multiple times, it will be down to the group to decide but we will either need to keep the current marketing tracking system in place or find an alternative method.

column793: 26/May/25 11:15 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;Have arranged meetings with each team to review what numbers are used and what are not and to gather requirements around how inbound calls could be better handled.
column794:
29/May/25 9:44 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;Have spoken with each team to understand what numbers are in use from their point of view and handed over my work to [~accountid:712020:3c78cb47-cb1f-4251-8f4a-05efa58336fc] so she can provide her input.

I have time organised with Steve to go over my finding and discuss my intentions, this way we can confirm the exact function of any line slated for closure to ensure we do not cause disruption. I have had no response to the meeting request though and cannot move forward without it.

Once I have confirmation of what can be closed the intention is that we aim for 1 number per branch and 2 numbers per department (AU & NZ). These numbers should be used for both inbound and outbound calls and registered so that our calls to don’t appear to be spam.

We then ensure that all reporting and business cards etc. show the correct number.

column1: Amazon connect as an SMS platform
column28: Feedback from some areas of the business is that Reclaim as an SMS platform is not up to standard, it is difficult for users to track a conversation history and be notified of a new SMS, the RMS team have asked the question ‘can Amazon connect be used instead’.

Local ops duties are to manage the branch and logistics, removing the call function from their role will allow them to focus on this.

01/Apr/25 2:32 PM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;As some prep I spoke with Talia in Recoveries as I had a distant memory of a banner showing a missed call in AC when I used to use it.

Upon the first missed call to Talia’s extension a missed call is shown (below image) but I then made a second call from my phone and AC continued to only show the first missed call.

It is only if I leave a voicemail that Talia is notified I tried to contact her via email with a transcript of the voicemail message.

Ideally we would be able to see a call history similar to what you see on a mobile phone showing incoming, outgoing and missed calls over time.


!image-20250401-033145.png|width=800,height=430,alt="image-20250401-033145.png"!

I will need to confirm that the same rules apply to the contact centre teams.

Spoke with [~accountid:712020:19c9fbf8-8942-4a6a-b36a-c819be1e1dcf] who provided insight as to how RMS, Ops and Local ops phonelines work, need for missed call notification may not be there as numbers are not personalised like in the above example, we need to ensure that missed calls are captured and returned but this can be done using AC reporting, need to expand the requirement to understand what the route cause of the problem is.

column1: Call Routing - IVR Review and update
column28:
There are a number of points being made around call routing and the IVR

* Need to route calls to the appropriate first responder
* Update sub options for 1300/0800 from 'New' and 'Existing' to 'Upcoming Reservation' and 'Already in a Vehicle'
* Removed sub-IVR vehicle type options, calls go directly to the Customer Ops team.
* Update Already in Vehicle Sub Options: 
*# Accident in R2D Vehicle: remains going to Branch Ops and voicemail?
*# Tolls: direct to fleet and voicemail? 
*# All other queries – TBD 

It is clear that both the numbers customers are calling and the IVR options they are presented with are not working

Ben advised call received from At Fault and there is no option for them in the IVR, this is something we will need to add in.

Incorporate parts of smart routing where possible, to file handler etc where possible.

column1: Call Routing - Preventing call drop off
column28:
There are a number of points being made about abandoned calls, voicemail and overflow, this whole process needs a look.

* We need to do away with voicemail and give the customer the option to remain on hold
* The RSM team would like their calls to go to a voicemail rather than be routed to another department
* We want to implement a call back function to allow customer to arrange a call back time suitable for them
* We want to push abandoned calls into the call back queue



These ideas need to be reviewed and a decision made on how we want to handle calls that are not answered.
column565: Future Considerations could include details such as UX simplification and alignment (e.g. going from 9 screens for one type of data set down to 1-2 screens), considerations for improving data quality / master data mgmt., etc.
column663:
Updating the options for customer from voicemail to

# Continue holding
# Organising a callback
# Virtual Hold
# Expand overflow

Will result in more successful calls for both inbound and outbound.

For abandoned calls rather than call back blindly we should send an SMS asking the customer if they would like a call back.

column1: R2D Customer Portal Redesign - Business Requirements
column28:
+*Data Protection*+
*As an* organisation

*I want* all users of the customer portal to have a unique log in

*so that* I can ensure data is secure

*As an* organisation

*I want* 2 step verification to be adhered to when users log in

*so that* I can ensure data is secure

+*Non-functional requirements*+
*As a* customer

*I want* to be able to access the portal on my mobile

*so that* I can refer customers while on the move

*As an* organisation

*I want* a link to the customer portal to be included on the appropriate templates

*so that* the customer is enabled to use it

*As an* customer

*I want* to receive notifications that action is required via the customer portal

*so that* I am aware when my attention is needed

*As an* customer

*I want* a chatbot to use when I need help

*so that* I receive assistance when I need it

*As an* customer

*I want* links to the portal to be usable regardless of age

*so that* I do not need a new link each time I want to access the portal

+*Account management*+
*As a* customer

*I want* to be able to update my details on the portal

*so that* my data is up to date

+*Documentation*+
*As a* customer

*I want* to be able to upload documentation

*so that* I do not have to email or SMS confidential information


+*FAQ*+

*As a* customer

*I want* access to a knowledge base

*so that* I know what to do in the event of an accident

*As a* customer

*I want* access to a knowledge base

*so that* I know what to do in the event of a fault vehicle

*As a* customer

*I want* access to a knowledge base

*so that* I know what to do in the event toll notice

*As a* customer

*I want* access to a knowledge base

*so that* I know what to do in the event of an infringement notice

*As a* customer

*I want* access to a knowledge base

*so that* I know what to do in the event being requested to pay GST

*As a* customer

*I want* access to a knowledge base

*so that* I know how recovery of hire car expenses work

*As a* customer

*I want* access to a knowledge base

*so that* I know why legal proceeding may be required

+*Hire management*+
*As a* customer

*I want* to be able to book delivery/return using the portal

*so that* I do not have to contact you via phone

*As a* customer

*I want* to be able to make payments via the portal

*so that* I do not have to do bank transfers

*As a* customer

*I want* to be able to advise R2D of issues with the rental vehicle

*so that* I do not have to contact you via phone


+*Roadside Assist*+
*As a* customer

*I want* information on what to do in the event of a breakdown

*so that* I know who to contact in an emergency

+*Tolls and Infringements*+
*As a* customer

*I want* to be able to view toll notices

*so that* review them and pay

*As a* customer

*I want* to be able to raise a dispute and provide supporting evidence

*so that* the toll charge can be reviewed

*As a* organisation

*I want* a payment platform for customers to pay their fines

*so that* payment is easy for them

*As a* fleet team member

*I want* information available on fees associated with tolls

*so that* customers understand why they have been charged

+*Reporting an accident*+
*As a* Fleet team member

*I want* customers to complete the claim form via the portal

*so that* we are not required to send them a copy for them to return

*As a* customer

*I want* clear instruction on what to do in the event of an accident

*so that* I know what to do
column411:
+*Data Protection*+

*Given* a customer wants access to the customer portal

*When* they log in

*Then* they must use their unique login information

*Given* a customer wants access to the customer portal

*When* they log in

*Then* they must complete 2 step verification 

+*Non-functional requirements*+
*Given* a customer wants access to the customer portal

*When* they are away from a PC

*Then* they can use their mobile device

*Given* a customer receives an email requesting action

*When* they receive the communication

*Then* a link to the customer portal is provided

*Given* R2D requires information from the customer

*When* the request is made

*Then* a link to the customer portal is provided

*Given* a customer is using the customer portal

*When* they need assistance

*Then* they have the use of an AI chatbot to assist

*Given* a customer want to log into the customer portal

*When* they click a link

*Then* they are directed to the portal log in page regardless of the links age

+*Account management*+

*Given* a customer has new contact details

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they are able to update their personal information


+*Documentation*+
*Given* a customer has documentation to provide

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they are able to upload their documentation

*Given* a customer wants to view their documentation

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they are able to view all documentation

+*FAQ*+

*Given* a customer is unsure of what action to take

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they are able to view a details FAQ section to advise them

*Given* a customer is unsure of what action to take in the event of an accident

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they are able to view a details FAQ section to advise them

*Given* a customer is unsure of what action to take in the event of a difficult at fault

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they are able to view a details FAQ section to advise them

*Given* a customer is unsure of what action to take in the event of a toll notice

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they are able to view a details FAQ section to advise them


*Given* a customer is unsure of what action to take in the event of an infringement

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they are able to view a details FAQ section to advise them


*Given* a customer is unsure of what action to take in the event being asked to pay GST

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they are able to view a details FAQ section to advise them


*Given* a customer is unsure of how the recovery process works

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they are able to view a details FAQ section to advise them


*Given* a customer is unsure of how the Legal process works

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they are able to view a details FAQ section to advise them

+*Hire management*+

*Given* a customer wants to return our vehicle

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they are able to request collection of the vehicle

*Given* a customer needs to make a payment

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they have access to a payment platform

*Given* a customer's hire vehicle is experience problems

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they can report the problems for R2D to action

+*Roadside Assist*+

*Given* a customer's hire vehicle has broken down

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they can see clearly what actions they should take

+*Tolls and Infringements*+

*Given* a customer has been issued a toll notice

*When* they are logged into the customer portal

*Then* they can view the toll invoice and pay

*Given* a customer has been issued a toll notice

*When* they do not agree that they are liable 

*Then* they can raise a dispute and provide evidence to support

*Given* a customer has been issued a toll notice

*When* they review the invoice and see fees

*Then* they can view the FAQ section and understand what those fees are

+*Reporting an accident*+

*Given* a customer has been involved in an accident while driving our hire car

*When* they log into the customer portal

*Then* they can complete a claim form

*Given* a customer has been involved in an accident while driving our hire car

*When* they log into the customer portal

*Then* they have access to clear instructions on what to do in the event of an accident

column1: R2D Referrer Portal Redesign - Business Requirements
column28:
# *_Data Protection_*

*As an* organisation

*I want* all users of the referral portal to have a unique log in

*so that* I can ensure data is secure



*As an* organisation

*I want* 2 step verification to be adhered to when users log in

*so that* I can ensure data is secure



# *_Signing up new referrers_*

*As a* Potential referrer

*I want* to be able to sign up online 

*so that* I don’t have to complete a paper form



# *_Lead Monitoring_*

*As a* referrer

*I want* to be able to see how many leads I have referred and their status

*so that* I can monitor the performance of the leads I have referred



*As a* referrer

*I want* to be able to see how much I have received in lead fees and how much is pending

*so that* I am aware of how much capital I can expect



*As a* referrer

*I want* to see the reason any lead is cancelled

*so that* I can use this information to establish what is a good lead in future

# *_Referring a Lead_*

*As a* referrer

*I want* to be able to provide as little or as much data as I have

*so that* I am able to submit a lead regardless of completeness



*As a* referrer

*I want* to be able to upload supporting documentation to a referral

*so that* I providing a strong lead



*As a* referrer

*I want* to be able to update data on an existing referral

*so that* I providing as much data as possible



*As an* referrer

*I want* be able to select an address after entering limited information 

*so that* I do not have to type in the whole thing 



# *_Account Management_*

*As a* referrer

*I want* to be able to update my details on the portal

*so that* my data is up to date

*As a* referrer

*I want* to be able to add a multiple users with limited access

*so that* my staff can use the portal without seeing sensitive data



# *_Non-functional requirements_*

*As a* referrer

*I want* to be able to access the portal on my mible

*so that* I can refer customers while away from my desk



# *_RSM requirements_*

*As an* RSM

*I want* all data provided by the referrer to be uploaded to Reclaim

*so that* I can review the lead



*As an* RSM

*I want* referrers to still be able to refer lead using SMS and Email

*so that* they are not forced to use the referrer portal

*As an* RSM

*I want* measures in place to prevent duplicate applications 

*so that* customers cannot submit multiple applications for the same accident
column411:

* *Then:* I must use a unqique log in ID

* *Then:* I am able to see referral payments received and expected



* *Given:* I am referrer
* *When:* I view the portal
* *Then:* I am able to view all leads that are not accepted and the reason a lead was not accepted



* *Given:* I am referrer
* *When:* I submit a lead
* *Then:* I am able to do so with limited data



* *Given:* I am referrer
* *When:* I submit a lead
* *Then:* I am able to provide supporting documentation



* *Given:* I am referrer
* *When:* I have submitted a lead
* *Then:* I am able to provide additional information should I receive it

* *Then:* I am able to update my personal details such as address and payment information



* *Given:* I am referrer
* *When:* I am not available

* *Given:* I am referrer
* *When:* I am away from my PC
* *Then:* I can access the referrer portal from my phone



* *Given:* a lead is submitted via the referral portal
* *When:* the lead is submitted
* *Then:* the data is sent to Reclaim and a task is created for the relvant RSM user



* *Given:* I do not want to use the referrer portal
* *When:* I have a lead to submit
* *Then:* I am still able to submit via email/SMS



* *Given:* I am referring a lead
* *When:* I enter address inforamation
* *Then:* integration is triggered to find address information



* *Given:* I am referring a lead
* *When:* information on the lead matches a lead already submitted
* *Then:* the file is flagged as a duplicate to be reviewed by an RSM.
column790:
06/Jul/25 6:34 AM;712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa;[~accountid:62e9c03848e310e672957b88] 
*As an* RSM

*I want* measures in place to prevent duplicate applications

*so that* customers cannot submit multiple applications for the same accident

When you say customer - are we referring to the referrer or the actual NAF and will the measure be put in the referral portal or the R2D webportal, wherein we already have the customer’s details from the repairer and then the NAF tried to create an application via the website they will get an alert saying we already have an application for them?
column791:
07/Jul/25 9:51 AM;62e9c03848e310e672957b88;[~accountid:712020:7db64c45-139b-4582-abaa-4c3fa98288fa] when I say customer here I did mean the NAF, if they go online and the referrer submits via the portal then we need to ensure that the referrer gets their fee. We also want to prevent both ops and an RSM doing the same task. 

I anticipated this requirement being addressed in Reclaim when a lead is received a function to allow users to cross check against existing leads to ensure there is no double up. I’m glad you raised this as this is not addressed in the Confluence page and I need to understand what meassures if any are in place today.
